Let's get the free to play aspect out of the way first. I've spent only $15 on this game so far, and I didn't have to. I just wanted to buy cosmetics and support the developers. With a couple of exceptions of content reserved to Founders (people who funded the game's initial development), there is no gear that is locked behind a paywall (and their exclusive gear isn't even good). Only some cosmetics are locked behind a pay wall, and most other cosmetics can still be bought with platinum. Platinum being the game's premium currency, which can be traded between players for rare gear that drops in missions you can play for free. This game has the best free to play model of any I've played. One of my favorite aspects being, there are no premium or non-premium accounts. Every player is equal.  What about gameplay? Well the amount of playstyles and weapons offered to the player will keep you trying new things for a very long time. As of writing this there are 29 unique classes (refered to as Warframes, roll credits) in the game, with a 30th to be added in the coming months. There are hundreds of weapons to choose from, and almost half of them are actually good. Movement is fluid and satisfying, with momentum giving weight to the player's actions.   Story in Warframe didn't really used to matter. But over time, lore was built into a world that is really shaping up. Through quests outright telling you things, to passing comments from NPCs, and codex entires gained by scanning an enemy enough times, a universe is crafted that will keep you interested and wanting to know more. There's more to this story and the answers are waiting.  Endgame is not very well defined at the moment, but hopefully that will change sometime this year. Fashionframe is the true endgame anyway.  I highly recommend this game to anyone who likes action. There is likely to be something for you in here. Want to grab an assault rifle and mow down enemies? You can do that. Want to use powerful abilities to clear a room? You can do that. Want to take a big sword and cut everything in half? Go ahead. There is something for everyone.

Also, premium currency is tradable in the community trading market, which makes the game fun and playable without paying. Not saying that if you don't pay 40$ you won't have very good stuff and destroy normal missions, but you don't need to pay that much. The game is very fun and skipping everything is useless, because you can aquire everything just by playing. Great game in all, although it has a couple ''Pay2Skip'' features. Watever, I love it.

This game is very good right, but as every game, it has it's issues. I will like try to share the expirience I had with the game so far so keep in mind that everything I say about the game is my personal opinion and it doesn't have to match with yours. First whats so good about the game?  1. It's free to play right? Even if you dont enjoy the game you didn't pay sh*t to play it  2. Multiplayer. Warframe is like 90% about playing with your friends/guild members. What a surprize since it is MMO, right?  3. Tons of content. There is like a 1000000 of different weapons, warframes and even events/alert missions.  4. Graphics. Warframe has such a beautiful graphics for a F2P game, it even competes with some of the greater non-F2P games (imo)  5. Character customization. OK, it's not like Blade&Soul level of character customization, but it's still really good. Every Warframe has it's own skins and you can recolor litteraly everything. Even the pets and ship etc etc.  6. Map/Missions. The map in Warframe is really big, right? It's like the whole solar system. On each planet you have like 15-20 missions and if you dont like doing that much stuff before moving to the next planet, dont worry. You only have to complete a couple of missions in order to unlock the next planet.  7. The game gets a lot of updates in which new weapons, warframes or enemies are added. Sometimes even new mission types, raids or boss remakes but none of these are actually that common.  8. If lore is something you like about games dont worry, because warframe got a lot of lore and more is yet to come. If you dont like it, well nobody is forcing you to watch the cinematics or read the lore. It's up to you.  9. It's not pay2win. The only thing you can buy with premium currency (platinum) and not with normal currency (credits) are some skins and resources from shop. Thats it. Everything else you can get simply by playing. Plus you can get platinum from trading with other players, so you dont even have to spend money to get these skins  Sounds pretty nice for an F2P games, right? But it has it's cons. Not much, but pretty significant ones.  1. Grind. Everything you do in warframe is grinding resources, bosses and other suff. Over some time grinding the basic stuff gets boring. But there are many ways to speed up the farming.  2. End game. This is the reason I don't play much lately. Not so far ago, EG/endless EG missions (Void missions) you had to do in order to get EG stuff got removed from the game and instead Void Nodes got added, I won't explain what these are because it would be pretty long. In short, huuuuge part of EG was removed, but more EG weapons are being added and investing time in upgrading them is like completely useless right now because all you would get from that is overkilling the enemies even more.  OK, that's it. I would recommend warframe to you if you wanted to play it for some time AND to play it with friends. Rating: 5/10 before 100 hrs; 9/10 100-1000 hrs; 7,5/10 1000+ hrs Hope this review helped :) PS. Sorry for my english, it's not my mother langage :P

Warframe is a sci- fi free to play game that does require some grinding for levels and materials, but like any other games in this genre it seems typical to. This game is reminiscent of Destiny, Halo and Mass Effect in it's own way. Unlike other free games there isn't a very big pay2win element, there is the choice of buying new warframes and more platinum but many of this games features are free. So far there are no 'exclusive' missions for paying users and this makes Warframe good as a free game. You can link your steam account easily but you must use a DE account to play it.   Graphics - fantastic, sharp crisp colours and imagery that catches the eye Gameplay- simple, and is flexible to allow users to play dual xbox 360 controller and keyboard at the same time XP System- the more you use a weapon you level up, ranking system is interesting and thus far it's easy on the new/casual/pro player  Overall rating: 9.5 out of 10 Stars  The one thing I would like to be added if not implemented to add the ability to gain platinum through missions so that it can be obtained without paying real world money for it.

After 480 hours in this game I think to myself 'was that time well spent?' looking out the window I come up with my answer 'YEAH IT WAS!' Warframe is an absolutly awesome game. It is a game about freakin space ninjas, whats not to like. It is an RPG, whats not to like. Its FREE, whats not to like. there is absolutly no reason for you not to try it out if you haven't already and if you have and you are burned out, get some friends, make a caln with a name that only you guys would understand, and do void missions and make millions of bucks (or credits).  I have spent a lot of time playing warframe. I made my account a little over a year ago in update 13. Since then, the game is almost un recognizable. The only things that are the same are the weapons, warframes, a couple of the bosses, and a couple of the tile sets. This is why I have been kept to one burn out in that time.  When I started playing warframe, my most played game on steam was star wars battlefront 2 and I had 24 hours on it. My friends got me into warframe right as summer break started and I spent almost the entire summer playing warframe (Half ot that time was probably spent farming nerodes for anyone who remembers farming survival on earth). I burned out aound update 14.5 and didn't get back into it until update 16.5. That might sound like a long time but it was only a couple of months. That is how fast the game changes. The devs are always working to change the game for the better and you can see that in all of the content the devs post on twitch and youtube.  Warframe is like any other online gam, it is going to be hard for new players to fit in. Warframe is very grindy. I have heard people call it warfarm because the farm involved can get extremely intense. However if you can handle the farm, The result is very rewarding.  Another thing that turns people off warframe is that it is free. The steriotipical free game now is full of in game purchases . Warframe does have in game purchases but by no means do you need to buy anything. That being said, If you ask anyone who has been playing the game for a while, 999999/100000 of them will tell you they have bought some amount of platinum (what you buy). There is no reason to say that warframe is pay to win and that is why you don't play it. Everything can be obtained in game without platinum except cosmetics which don't really do anything but look different.  Overall, Warframe is a fantastic game. If you can put up with the grind and the ocassonal bugs (which are usually pretty hilarious) and you like RPGs, you should try this game out.

Game type: MMO / Third person / Free2Play (but in a good way!) / Shooter / Hack and Slash / RPG.  This one is very different from most pay2plays out there. You can reliably get almost anything in-game that you could want. I am sure there are one or two things only available to people who have paid money into the game, but any weapon or warframe worth having, can drop during the game. All without endlessly farming for the same materials. You can end up with great weapons, skills and 'warframes' (the games answer to a suit of mech armor.. I guess) just by playing the game regularly. No extra, obnoxious farming.. although you will probably be 'farming' for hours anyways.. levelling up your,  everything  is key to having the most powerful weapons and skills.   Skills.. oh my god if I could describe how the skills can vary from person to person, warframe to warframe, weapon to weapon it would take me a degree in math and I would still have to write an entire article in order to describe it. (A tutorial would take an entire wiki). You level up (your account) on a fairly regular basis.. but can only take the test to level up once every 24hrs. This however doesn't impede your ability to progress and make gains on your character/frame/weapon combination, as each fight may drastically alter the way that you choose to play  your  game permanently, or perhaps just for certain missions. Anyways, it's been said before.. but never by me- The possibilities are nearly endless. They are legitimately endless if development continues on the game and the growth is exponential with each update.  No need to worry about Mic-spamming kids in this game, the voice-chat is nearly unusable, and encourages the use of teamspeak.  My advice, get a group together (either IRL friends or use the lobby to  quickly  put together a squad of unstoppable ninja!) and get into this game, it's the only way you'll understand.. and remember when playing - The wiki is written by people with experience and will save you hours of potentially wasted time.  Good luck, and honestly.. try it out. You will probably like it.

Warframe is a Third-Person Over-the-Shoulder co-op based shooter with handful of action combined with futuristic space theme. In Warframe, you are a warrior with a special 'warframes' suit equipped with wide variety of unique abilities and advantages it provide. Usual gameplay can be defined as eliminating enemies in a mission, surviving, defending, espionage and occational speical missions with rather different objectives. Goal of the game is not completely set, you can play to complete the 'lore' quests that contains cinematic explaination ofnthe story behind the current universe, the story is not yet complete as developers are adding more features along with frequent development in cinematic story line. Aside from the quests, you are free to pursue whatever gamemode or objectives, there are random occasionaln 'alerts' that is available from time to time with many rewards, also you can run seasonal sorties to not to get sick of doing same thing over and over. The game is still being developed and additional contents are being added as time comes also, there is a solid community out there keeping game alive and beating.  Going further, you are able to go on missions to 'voids' to get versatile, better 'prime' weapons and 'prime' warframes which helps you in exploring high difficulty missions. As it is for most of Free-To-Play games, there is an option to purchase in-game currency which could potentially reduce your time spent on void and support the game developers. The in-game currency can be easily earned/traded by selling prime stuff and weapon/warframe modifications to other players owning the currency and you can pretty much buy crucial things without purchasing it with real money. What happens when you combine the Parkour from Mirrors Edge, with Bullet Physics, Moba-like Power-ups and Melee? An unplayable pulp... And yes, that’s what Warframe was for a while… Unplayable, confusing, straight up bad...    But this game has seen in its one and a half year of existence, more attention than any other game I have ever played, and it was attention from the Devs, and Players alike. Its step by step evolution from unplayable to epic was a long journey, one that I was a part of. Warframe is now closer to the final draft than ever before, and in my opinion is one of the few fun and original shooters out there…   The current mechanics offer a great spice up to the genre and the co-op focused nature of the game makes it feel like an epic RPG rather than a generic VS shooter…  The amazing character designs and settings, the concept and the lore of the game are delivered in an amazing way. They make this game pleasant without much unnecessary dialogue and cutscenes, and the ran-gen nature of the map and enemies, is a powerful tool, than ensures differentiation in weapons and tactics, even if you are to play the same level again, you will never find the same enemies at the same place, using the same gun…  Don’t let the “Free to play” scare you away! Warframe is a no-Paywall game… You can craft everything in there through normal gameplay, get the materials and build all the things! Or you can buy them with platinum to support the game! (You need Platinum to buy weapons slots and cosmetics)  Yes, Warframe is not a perfect game, and it’s not a finished game… It can be really frustrating at times and it lacks many things. But it’s finally on the right path. Seeing a game get from unplayable to amazing doesn’t happen often. But what I always saw, is that Warframe has this, sort of retrieving quality… Maybe it’s the community, maybe it’s the huge flow of quality content, maybe it’s just the stunning way this game looks, maybe it’s the sheer fun this game exhales, maybe it's the people that I met in the game, the tenno in my clan, or maybe it’s just me… I could never stop playing this game…  It’s only clear that we have a gem in our hands, and that it gets brighter every day…   Warframe, you won! Tenno on guys! ^^

Warning: This review may be long and/or all over the place.  After playing this game for a while I finally decided to make a review on it. I have been addicted to this game. (Have about 145 hours or something like that of playtime on it) I usually get addicted to games for a little bit but this is the longest addiction I have ever had. The game is really fun especially when you play with friends, it can be really easy but also insanely challenging and I think the developers did a good job on balancing the resources and difficulties out. There are so many amazing Warframes and weapons to choose from and I love how you have to earn everything, like to get a Warframe you have to do certain missions to get the parts and then you have to get resources to build those parts. It makes you become really proud of yourself after finishing something! :D It does involve premium currency but you can actually earn that without buying it so nothing is impossible for you to get. I haven't been involved with the community a whole lot but I do know that everyone is friendly and easy to get along with, two nice people joined my public match once and it was quite fun. :) There is this thing called a Dojo and that's basically where you and your clan can hang out, you can build rooms, labs, decorations, etc. To be honest I am obsessed with building up my Dojo.  I think that's all I'm going to tell, there is so much more that I haven't told but you can discover everything on your own. If you're unsure about playing this don't be, after all the game is free! Hope to see you around in Warframe. ;)

First off, this game is free, so you should just check it out right now.   Okay, with that out of the way, I love this game so much. If you are here for some of the best 3rd person combat (shooting & melee), solid co-op multiplayer, a fantastic leveling/upgrading system that really allows for some personal custimaztion based on your playstyle, and very (VERY) pretty graphics in an engine that runs incredibly well, then you are here for the right reasons.   My biggest issue with the game used to be the lack of variety in environments, but that is no longer a problem. From when I started playing the game in closed beta, there are now 3-4 times as many areas. With the different mods in each area (now twice as many modes) and the randomly generated maps (as in the style of Diablo II & III), environments are very varied.  Of course, with it a F2P game, you're likely skeptical about whether or not it is Pay2Win or not. While it isn't as fair of a model as Loadout or Path of Exile, it is probably the best model out there. I logged around 200 hours before ever spending money and I only used that money to buy weapon slots and visual upgrades seeing as how it's so much fun to actually earn weapons and frames in this game.  I would say this game is 1 part Mass Effect 3's multiplayer, 1 part Left4Dead, and 1 part Prince of Persia/Mirrors Edge. If that sounds like a great time to you (I hope it does), then start downloading. Again, it is free and also the game is a pretty darn small file size.   5/5

I can highly recommend this game to people who like third person shooters. It is a freerun (very good movement to get quickly around the maps), coöp ninja space hack'n slash shooter. It has many different area's and in each area it generates a new order of chambers to make the completion run slightly different every time. Also it's free to play so why wouldn't you try it out?   The PvP isn't really great, but it is mostly a coöp PvE game anyway. This game is much about farming resources and bleuprints for new equipment, weapons and suits/characters. There is a trading system in game to make getting the prime bleu prints easier. You can ofcourse spend money on additional stuff (it isn't a pay to win game). It isn't necessary to do so, by using trading you can get those items anyway but it'll take way longer ofc. I had played this game for more then 1800 hours before spending money on it, I have now though, because I wanted some skins and didn't want to sit in trading chat for a while.  If you become really good at playing and speeding trough missions, it can become kind of a bore and annoyance to drag noob players across the map. If I play a non highest tier mission with players that are not on my friend list, 99% of the games I play will result in me having done more 90% of all damage and me waiting at a door that needs 2 players to open....   Also there is not really much of an end game and if you want to play this game for melee mostly then don't, it's a shooter and although they buffed melee a bit by adding some new mods and changing it a bit, shooting is still way more viable and less spammy. If you want to go full melee, I'd say make a macro that just spams E on toggle or something similar.  Conlusion: It's good and free, by far my most played game on steam.

Warframe, a Free-to-Play cooperative game, that implies the title of 'Free-to-Play.'  The story of Warframe? Not too much is known, but a basic understanding of it is - it's a spiratual sequel to Dark Sector, which pulls some ties in from said game like the Technocyte Virus etc. You are Tenno, a species of human mutated from the Technocyte Virus. The suit, known as a Warframe is the suit that gives the user increased power. The Lotus, the one who guides the Tenno, asks of you to restore the balance to a universe at war. That is a very broad understanding of the story. There are various bits and pieces of lore in the Codex, but I'll keep the story asset brief.  The aesthetics of the game are pretty original, mostly harkening with the Warframes especially. Everything looks sleek and organic. It's charming to say the least.  As for the game itself, it is pretty fun. While people start out with a minimal amount of equipment, which can be considered a subtracting point, the player is given fifty starting paid-for currency, enough for a mixture of Warframe slots and weapon slots. These slots allow you to acquire more Warframes and weapons throughout your career as a Tenno. The starter equipment aforementioned which excludes the unique choice of Warframe, is nothing to write home about - a slow-firing automatic rifle, a basic sidearm and sword. But those aren't your only weapons you can acquire; a plethora of weapons can be utilized at the players own discretion. Things like 'heavy' automatic rifles, to whips, to lightning-chaining weapons.  The only problem being with the weapons, are the same-y aspects of them. Most bullet-based weapons behave like a laserbeam; accurate at all distances, with little felt recoil. As well, most of these weapons aren't 'unique.' Very few can be considered unique, but that doesn't stop the same aspect as above.   The Warframes themselves are unique. Each one respects a different element in themselves. While it may take a few runs to get the components (this will be elaborated further), they are a powerful addition to anyone who can utilize them effectively. Ember can use her flames to scorch the masses, Frost can utilize his abilities to protect hardpoints or teammates alike. Things like these help make the game varied with different ways to play.  With weapons and Warframes comes building them. You can buy these from the in-game market, coming in two flavors - the Platinum (paid) edition, or the DIY edition. Buying with paid-for currency, not only yields the weapon/Warframe in question, but it being supercharged (more mod points), and a free weapon/Warframe slot. DIY is where you need the components and resources to build said item. Things like Alloy Plate, Plastids, to a Warframe Chassis, Helmet and Systems, all funnel into the crafting system.  The crafting system is not state-of-the-art, as you cannot create multiples of the same item (Ie: I can only build one Health Restore, wait until it is finished building, then craft another one...), but this is where all of the aspects show the Free-to-Play mantra. Everything can be acquired in the game trough the usage of in-game currency and time. If you want to build a Warframe? Do you have at least a few days? You can build him/her. Want that shiny new weapon? Have twelve hours to a day to spare? Build it.  To elaborate further, weapons and Warframes can be enhanced even further with the use of mods. They are just basic alterations, that can squeeze out more power out of your weapons. Basic damage upgrades to elemental damages, things like that can help you progress even further. Simple as that. Getting an Orokin Catalyst or Reactor will fuel more mod points into your weapons and Warframes respectively. But that doesn't mean that there are 'essential' mods, which make certain mods more useless than others. I won't go into detail into that, but some mods are unquantifiably essential than others.  Another part of the game is... Grinding. It is part of every game to increase the longevity of the game. RNG rules all in this department, whether it is to get a component or a mod. This might be a slight turn-off point for many, and is a slight brick wall. You'll have to do a lot of said act to acquire the best gear. It takes a large sum of time to get maximum power. To lessen this is trading. You can trade mods or paid currency to get those mods you can't get, or cheese through the effort of getting one.  All in all, Warframe is fun if you can get passed the grinding. Better with a group of friends, as most games are. The only problem is the early-game, grinding and some of the wait-times. Would I recommend it? It is free, so why not?  If you get this far, then thanks for reading. Have fun!

Third Person Shooter with wallrunning and totally playable without spending money.  My favorite game on Steam, and if that isnt enough... The game has tripled its contents since i started playing and is still expanding to get more variety.  The UPS: Action packed, good graphics, good multiplayer experience. Constant flow of new weapons, balance patches and huge additions. Dedicated developers. Suprisingly fair business model, you dont have to pay a thing, ever, if you dont care about keeping every single weapon (you totally dont have to). A good amount of the guns haver their own firing mechanics, and the new mod system allows for weapons to be buffed against certain enemies and purposes.  The DOWNS: Can get grindy, very very CPU intense. Some of you might be put off by constant changes to the balance that the game is undergoing in the last half year. But thats why its a beta, and it wont go on for long. Another prolbem at the moment is that two of the tilesets are somewhat overused, but those get slowly replaced as new tilesets come along.  I can only recommend it, its a ton of fun, and its free. What can you loose by trying it at least once? 'nuff said.

CO-OP game, repetitive and grindy, lots of farming, however, still in beta, constant updates and a unique combat system with interesting mechanics.  PVP is there, but the main focus is PVE.  Also PVP is unbalanced, no pay 2 win, however limiting for someone who doesn't pay money, can trade for currency to buy store items.  Limited Customization for starters, being limited to 3 Warframes and a small pallete of colors, but still fair in terms of unlocking weapons and crafting other frames.  Warframes offer plenty of playstyles, however, certain playstyles, like stealth, are unrewarding compared to just running through the levels with someone who can blow everything up.  Certain weapons are useless, other weapons are OP, creating an uneven field and also making the game boring by having less variety until weapons are balanced.  Unique movement system, however can be greatly improved upon if the devs worked on it. Current movement has wallrunning, sliding, and using melee weapons to turn yourself into a helicopter due to the speed boost from swinging it.  Despite this, many viable playstyles and a decent amount of variety, but again, would be more variety should other weapons be balanced.  Terrible AI, the AI is very dumb. Some AI are just faster than others and can perform different manuevers, however, they still lack a logical thinking process. Many will run up to you head-on, or will hide and take cover and allow you to pick them off, without thinking to move. Bosses have unique prospects, but are still pretty stupid.  Game currently only rewards rushing, stealth is not possible, and few tactical options outside of warframe abilities.  Very few variety between missions, there is defense, survival and extermination, along with another mission type which involves blowing up an object.  There is also one where you run around and capture points, but that is only one ONE mission.  Could use plenty more mission types.

Let's go ahead and describe Warframe's plot in the most simplest form: You're a ninja. In space. Ok, review's over go home. Wait, you're still reading this? Alright, fine, let's keep it going. Frames at War is a third-person action shooter space ninja simulator where you and up to three other players test your mettle against three woefully unprepared factions: The Space Merchants, Heavy Metal Russians and the Zerg. You battle through waves upon waves of commuters on their way to work/home to provide for/see their families and slice/blast/shoot them to little pieces in your magical superman/woman body suit with your crazy monofilamentvibrobladeanthrax dispensers, which you can purchase blueprints for OR you can find parts in Goldfinger's space palaces to create blinged out versions of them. Speaking of blinged out things, this game is Free to Play, but actually done well. You can almost get ANYTHING in this game without spending ANY money at all and not feel jaded at the massive time you've wasted doing so. That is, until you want to feel special and buy a buttload of cosmetics. At that point, you can either blow money on Platinum or have some other dumb sucker do the same to buy junk from you in the trade channel. What I take away from the whole experience is that you're a monster who hurts people for fun and profit.  I really like this game.

Looks Good, Runs well on my machine, and is co-op.   #Freetoplay, #Installthis, #Playwithfriends ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// This was my Review when I had pumped almost 6 hours into this game, blinded by the depth of the crafting table, resource gathering and exploring the solar system.   240 hours in I can say this game is nothing but a glorified farming simulator, you spend hours grinding for gear you think you need, 15 min for one little resource that you need out of 5 to build your little potato so you can make your warframe more powerfull, oh big whoop! but imagine grinding 15 min for reasources 5x for each of your weapons? and I have about 8 weapons, 6 warframes and a ♥♥♥♥ tonne of blue prints.   Okay so you level up and grind untill you have such an over powerd warframe that you can take on the later levels with ease, but guess what? now you have access to the void on wow! this game is soo indepth I never saw this coming new levels and everything. The enemies get a new skin, do more damage and its all pretty much the same but in these levels staying alive 20 minutes or more only gets you the good resources, so you gotta keep grinding. Just keep swimming for the ultimate goal right? what goal? you allready have all you want, oh but what about that one warframe that you dont have Vulban, who can only be unlocked by spending all your waking hours on the game to catch the 3 alert missions you need to grab all his parts, they come and go randomly in the game and sometimes only last an hour, without all 3 parts you cant build ♥♥♥♥ and are left with no way of gaining the others untill you find and play the next super rare alert mission.   It took me 240 hours before I could build Vulban, I played with him for 4 hours, yea hes pretty ♥♥♥♥ing sweet. but not worth it in my opinion. Now there is nothign more I wish to do. Nohting more I wish to see. I have finaly escaped the grind for resources and see little else in this game.   7/10

Warframe  Warframe started as a decent co-op shooter.  On early beta it had some game breaking bugs, but it felt like it had a lot of potential, that potential is still there and i doubt it will fade away easily.  The level design is pretty amazing, the tilesets have as much quality as a AAA title but they get very repetitive with time, the 'endgame' void missions can be described as 'kill mobs, loot the room and occasionally look for secrets, rinse and repeat',  The Bosses started out as pretty meaningful and provided an actual challenge, nowadays they're a means to earn blueprints of specific frames and are incredibly hard, with the inclusion of a specific set of bosses that have a specific weak spot which only works half of the time. The best boss fight is in my honest opinion Lephantis.  Every update they release there are more bugs than additions, though most of which get solved pretty fast.  The game has become quite a farm fest, earning the game the term 'Warfarm'.   The Devs are terrible at balancing the game, specificly by overly nerfing frames and weapons and hardly ever buffing others.  The grinding involved in farming for frames is extreme and is a great drawback of the game.  Crafting weapons take usually 12 hours, companions and rare materials take up to 24 hours. the new Archwing takes 36 hours to build, and frames take 72 hours. Its tedious to wait so long for new gear.  This New Archwing update is lame, the new tileset in space is devoid of content, its literally the same map. starts in the same place, ends in the same place but has you go through different pathways to achieve your objective.   But to be quite honest, i've went on and on about how terrible this game is, but its still one of my favorite games and i have spent up to 8 hours in it alone, playing with friends.  It's got its share of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t sure, but they still somehow manage to deliver on a great time which is quite a feat, ive not exacly been easy on the examples of how terrible it is.  I'm not gonna rate this game on a scale of any sorts, its a great game to spend some time in, but its below average in key aspects and needs improvement, and a lot of it, then again it's still in 'open beta' so we might see some positive changes over the course of development.

So, I've been playing this game for a long time, I have about 1400 hours in-game, and I think it's about time for me to review it. Since getting this game all that time ago, I have loved it. The combat is thrilling, the weapons are designed well, the movement is fast-paced and slick. The graphics are exceptional, especially for a free title. Each Warframe has its own kit of useful abilities, and despite what some people may say, they all have something positive to contribute to a squad. Personally, my favorite Warframes are (in order) Banshee, Chroma, Zephyr, Volt, Vauban, Hydroid, and Limbo. One of the major turn-offs to this game is the large grind required to advance, but with such an an immersive combat system, you won't get bored soon. Try Warframe, you will not be disappointed.

This is my first review so please give me some constructive criticism :)   Pros: + extremely fun with friends + over 175 different weapons currently available + levels are mostly randomly generated so every mission will be at least little different + 20 warframes currently to choose from + all the warframes have unique abilities and feel to them + awesome community and developers  Cons: - the game is at its core very repetive, so you might get bored easily  - some weapons and mods are not available anymore (they were limited time items or rewards in events) - building anything takes ridiculously long (weapons take 12-24 hours and warframes take 3 days and 12 hours to build+ farming for resources) - some items are imo overpriced ( a color palette is 5€ )  But to be totally honest the game is alot of fun. To me warframe is nowadays a junk food game, meaning that i play it always when there is a new update but i cant play a whole lot before i get bored again. Warframe is a third person, cooperative, free2play, action game with a strong sci-fi theme that emphasized fast-paced gunplay as well as melee combat.   What I like:  - Very stylish game, nice art style, unique aesthetic and you can do a lot of cool stuff like zipping around the level at high speeds, spinning through the air as a whirling tornado of blades and death and Max-Payne-Style bullet jumps while dual-wielding assault rifles - Large and ever expanding selection of weapons and abilities to use, there is something for everyone here. Want dual swords? Sure. Giant hammer? Of course. Machine guns that slice enemies to pieces? Yup. Shotgun-Axe-Hybrid-Thing? Yeah, game's got that too. - Large potential for optimization and different builds which is certain to please people that like to really get into the numbers game.  - Customization options are quite impressive. Even without paying for cosmetics you have a good number of options to make your character look the way you want. You can change the color of just about everything, including your 'hub area' space ship and a good number of cosmetics can be obtained just by playing the game. - Up until now (which is just over 50h in) the game has kept me motivated very well. It constantly throws new things at you (new weapons to craft and try out, access to more features, different mission types, etc.) even at this point which is nice.   What I don't like:  - A good number of systems that make up the meat of the game are barely explained if at all. If you want to get the most out of it, you'll have to read up on it outside the game. - Although the environments are generated somewhat randomly from pre-created tilesets it all blends together after a while and can get a bit samey. I recommend switching between the different planets frequently just to break it up a bit. - As is the nature of the beast, the game relies heavily on grinding for gear and replaying missions. This doesn't really bother me too much but I'm sure some people will be put off by playing the same mission 10 times in a row just to get the something they already have in abundance instead of the one piece they need.   Things to consider:  - While the game can be played solo for the most part it is definitely more enjoyable with a group, especially starting mid-game when the difficulty begins to ramp up. - I personally think the free2play model is well executed and fair, keeping most purchases completely optional. Many items in the item shop are priced quite highly though which - at least in my opinion - makes them not worth the money. I'd rather spend more time playing the game I enjoy then spending a lot of money on a shortcut. That said, there are a number of reasonably priced items in the shop that can enhance your game experience quite a bit. How you want to deal with that is of course up to you. It is entirely possible to get premium currency by selling rare items to other players for example so you don't have to spend actually money if you don't want to.   Conclusion:  I enjoy Warframe quite a bit and will surely continue to play more of it. Can't beat stylish space ninjas with lightning guns and fire swords.

This game is great if you're starting out fresh with a couple friends - all the new content (quests, Archwing, Kubrows) will keep you hooked for a couple days at the least, and the updates are regular enough to keep you hooked for a little more. At this point you'll feel there's just so much in the game you need to do and unlock and build and kill.  At the 20-50 hour mark you'll most likely be looking into guides for the 'best' weapon builds and loadouts. Get a FOO-strategy crit-build Soma, Rhino, and Zorens and you'll be breezing through missions.  At the 100-or so hour mark and you'll have shiny Prime weapons or frames, maybe a couple, to show off. You would be pretty familiar with all the game mechanics at this point, and if not, you'll probably be reading the Wiki. Maybe you'll spend some cash as well on Platinum currency or Prime access.  At the 200 hour mark you'll be done with all the available missions, and spend the majority of your time running endless Defense or Survival missions to grind those Prime parts you don't have. You'll have your trusty overused Soma to kill waves on waves on waves of enemies, but RNGsus will not be with you.  At the 500 hour mark you might get bored of your Soma and start grinding other weapons, either to level up your Mastery rank or finding a new playstyle with quirky weapon builds. Maybe both. You might dabble a bit in PvP and kick ♥♥♥ or get your ♥♥♥ kicked. You'll probably have given up on open matchmaking due to all the yolo-ing squad mates who die and ragequit when you can't revive them in time.   At the 1000 hour mark you'll probably be logging in once a week, maybe less, just to breeze through new content. You'll have developed a superiority complex that gets stroked every time you leave your private session cave and see the after-mission results screen. Or you'll rationalize that the guy who outdid you was a (insert ability name)-spamming noob.

But if you come in with some friends just looking to enjoy your self and taste some fine space murder then you will have a good time. The grinding is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t the wait times are lame, but the gameplay is nice the Gear is cool and the commnity is nice. Graphics and preformance are great. So go out there cut em up fill em with skeleingtoms.   EDIT: After dropping more time into the game, one final note. In my opinion the endgame is poorly designed. The design flaw lies in the fact that instead of adding new mechanics to make the endgame more challenging and rewarding they simply give enemies absurd amount of health and damage. Forcing players to adhere to only the highest tier weapons and frames. I didnt enjoy it very much.

Boy oh BOY, where do I begin with this one? Strap in, folks, because this gets a little lengthy.  I suppose I should say this: The game isn't a bad play. It controls well, it's stupidly fun, and it has some great mechanics. Want a shotgun that can blow apart your enemies, all while trying to sneak around? You can do that! Want to slaughter everything in sight with nothing but a sword? You can do that, too! Heck, take out a FLAMING KNIFE and go ham!  But that's about where the fun stops. Sure, running around and coming up with creative ways to kill your targets is fun, but in order to get anywhere in the game, you need new weapons, new Warframes, a trusty companion...Not to mention the materials to make those things. Even when you've gotten your gear to their maximum rank, you still need the materials to take them further, or work on that Grakata you've had sitting around in your inventory for a couple of weeks (that is, of course, if you even HAVE the inventory space, which you have to BUY with ACTUAL MONEY)  And that's where the game becomes a real disappointment. MMO's have always had that grind that players, for the most part, seem to be okay with in general. In THIS game, however, that's what you'll be doing about 80% of the time. Need that blueprint for the Rhino Warframe's Chassis? Go beat this boss! Oh, wait, did you want the NEUROPTICS blueprint? You already have that one? TOO BAD, FIGHT THE BOSS AGAIN! At this point, it should be said that the devs, despite these issues (as well as those below) being brought up by not just new players, but VETERAN players, as well, tend to ignore the idea of making certain things less of a pain in the @$$ to get. They've also been known to implement new features, and rarely address new or existing problems until much later on. Some bosses, for example, are nearly impossible to beat without endless patience or sheer dumb luck. Of course, the same thing can be said about materials.  Blueprints from bosses? Okay, I can understand that. But look at the materials needed for just the systems. With the last update, grinding became an even bigger pain, as a lot of the higher-tier materials were either made stupidly rare, or made impossible to craft without shelling out money from your own pocket to do so. Not to mention the fact that, if you want to get at those materials, you need to improve your loadout. Which requires, you guessed it, better weapons, better Warframes, better everything. Sure, you can mod the living crap out of that sweet 2-shot rifle you got, but it's not going to do anything after a certain point, as the enemies will likely be too strong for your weapon to damage significantly, even with the right mods attached. And, even if you DID have a better weapon on hand, you would still need to grind for those ranks. Wanna know something else? You only have a HANDFUL of weapon and Warframe slots in your arsenal. If you want more slots (which you DO want), you'll have to shell out Platinum for those slots, which requires money. To give you an idea as to how much you'd be spending on slots, 12 Platinum buys 2 slots. Out of the 75 you get from the five buck Plat Pack, you're spending a little less than a dollar. For inventroy space.  And, yes, you can get Platinum from other players. Trade people items they're looking for, like Blueprints, Prime Weapon parts, etc., and you'll have a little Platinum to spend. That's if, of course, you can find a buyer for your items.  I went into this came months back looking for a good game. I thought I had found it. Cyberninjas in space, ridiculous acrobatics combined with guns and blades (bows, too), and a bunch of factions that seem very interesting, with a lot of lore to keep any lorebuff happy for a while. I left it not only disappointed, but with a very bitter taste in my mouth. The grind went from somewhat acceptable to god-awful, the items NEEDED in order to get anywhere are either too difficult for many players to get at, or cost REAL WORLD CASH to get the blueprint for, that way you can completely bypass grinding for hours on end, just hoping to get that ONE. STINKING. NEURAL. SENSOR.  Call me a noob, a loser, a whiner, or whatever it is you high-rnked people call lower-level 'plebs'. It still doesn't mean that the points I brought up are not valid reasons to not play this game. Those points being:  -The grind can often take hours, even days, to give you that one items you're looking for, especially if it is overly rare.  -Items that are locked behind a level-wall that you can't get past, even with team mates, are locked behind a paywall. Just as an example: 1 Neural Sensor, which is needed for the Rhino Warframe's Systems, is 100 Platinum. You can get 75 for FIVE BUCKS. You're paying for that and then some in order to get a part that is needed at least once or twice in EVERY Warframe, which can hold back players unable to get to the planets with the resources needed, and can hold back those who do not have the extra cash to throw out.  -RNG has made things so difficult to get your hands on, that it sometimes takes hours to get that one thing you need. Blueprints, Kubrow Eggs, rare resources, it covers it all.  -Inventroy space, which is a COMMON and AVAILABLE thing in most other MMO's, requires actual money or more grinding in order to get. And, considering that there are SEVERAL types of inventory slots, the costs add up quickly.  -The devs. Seriously, look through some of the Vets' reviews, and you'll get a pretty good idea as to what sort of BS goes on.  I've stated my opinion on the game. Others have as well. Take all of that into consideration before you begin downloading this game, or consider spend a hundred bucks on this game. Just because a game LOOKS good, and PLAYS good, does not mean that it IS good.

So, I've played this game for about a year, and I have enjoyed it alot.  As I said I have played this game for a good ammount of time now, and I still enjoy it to this day. This game is a nice sci-fi game based on a shooter. This game has a nice renewing combat gameplay. You can choose between a lot of Warframes aka combat suit (not like a military suit but more like an alien suit), which gives you super powers like electical abilities.  The graphics are also worth mentioning. This game has verry good looks, and that for a free to play game. The character design is very good to, all the warframes (over 20) have very nice design.  Also this game is being updated nice and frequently, you almost get never bored in this game because of that. The updates are almost always nice and renewing updates together with bug fixes.  The one thing I don't really like about this game is that you don't get a lot of lore (I like reading the lore of a game and play lore wise). In this game I only know the lore of one warframe, and it is not that extensive.  As I said this is a really nice game at least worth checking it out, it is free so why not. I don't like the lack of lore but it is ballanced out with the nice content, and I think the lore will develop eventually. for a free to play game it is a verry beutiful and good game.

Warframe. It is most definately one of the best -free- multiplayer third person shooters I have ever had the honor to play. I would honestly reccomend this game above many triple A titles. The game itself has a decisive and interesting backstory. many playable 'Warframes' with unique and interesting mechanics that give your specific choice meaning in a varity of mission settings. Also perhaps one of the most important features. It's a constantly evolving game, new missions and interesting additions are being added in -monthly- giving this amazing game a ever-changing face and the fact you'll be supported by three additional 'Tenno' Three other players all working towards the same goal, means the missions the people and the very game itself is ever changing depending on the people you join with! ... It also has some interesting end-game content that relies far more on teamwork and less on pure shooting and running off on your own this can make it it even more complex and interesting later game. So remember folks, Gun or Blade are not a Tenno's best friend, trust in your Warframe. But even more. Trust in your allies..   'I am the lotus, I will guide you but we must hurry. Vor is coming for you. I see the cryo-sleep has taken your memory, It doesn't matter. you are Tenno. I will prepare you...'

It is difficult to write a truly objective review, because there are large problems with this game, despite very good first impression.   -THE BEST ASPECT of this game is that it is very nicely optimized, you don't need a new computer to enjoy eye-pleasing graphics and smooth gameplay, also it being free-to-play means you can try it out right now.  -THE BASICS are simple - the same third-person movement controls, ranged and melee combat, minimap with markers where to go, etc. HOWEVER, anything advanced, like mods, building weapons and new Warframes (classes) is very difficult, clad in unintuitive interface, which also for some reason is laggy. Yes - the game itself is smooth and simple, but the menu and interface is sluggish and a huge mess to understand anything about it.  -THE WORST ASPECT- it is pay-to-win. Understand this - any stat advantage, even time advantage you can buy with real money IS pay-to-win, only cosmetics are an exception, period. Yes, devs need to make money, but I would much rather prefer this game to be pay-to-play where everyone got equal opportunities, because, you know - I don't really like playing co-op with some paying user who rushes through and takes all kills / loot, and now I won't even comment about PvP!  -And it goes further - not just weapons, Warframes (classes) and real skins, even COLOURS for default skin are unlocked by real money, you get like one of each colour, like one red, one green, one blue, etc. but to get other TONES of the same colours, pay up!!! I was perplexed by such insolence, like - seriously??? Even if you find all ingredients to craft a weapon - it takes 24 HOURS to complete, but surprise surprise, you can hasten it by paying real money! Honestly - this game seems to be asking real money for ANYTHING, it is designed to make non-paying user experience as long and difficult as possible! Also the 'free-to-play' (or rather free to install) aspect means that the general chat is infested with the basic online obscenities, thus disabling chat becomes one of the first things to do.  -Even the good visual aspect of the game falls short - there are the same maps / themes recycled in different planets, like the snowy map in Venus, which doesn't make sense at all even for a fantasy game... and the cliché, uninspired techno-labyrinth theme which is the most common seriously gets boring after a while!    I am putting 'Recommended' only because the gameplay smoothness and graphics are stellar for a free-to-play game, you got nothing to lose to try it and most likely you will enjoy it, at least at the beginning, but investing yourself deeply in this game I do NOT recommend. Quick fun is what it is, but forget about any fair PvP and expect that your long-hard grinded gear will be nothing special, as anyone who is ready to pay will get it instantly.

As visually stunning as the environments in the game are, Warframe is surprisingly dull. Its fast paced gun play “ninja system” are coupled with some of the most tedious grinds in gaming history. I'm not even sure if MMO's have the level of mind numbing grind that this game introduces.  Since the SotR update, this game has suffered severe pacing issues. While introducing a interesting new Star Map, it has successfully gated content more harshly behind a silly 'Relic' system and made character progression repetitive and uninteresting.  While I'm sure future updates can lend to more interesting story telling in regards to its (alibet thin) overarching plot, this developer's business model is killing this game. Gating content while imposing a strict Pay-to-Win model of accessing basic items and weapons for progression (that later turn out to be wasted investments when used in missions), makes Warframe a terrible waste of time and money.

I've played a decent amount of this game going all the way back to its launch, and while its had its moments I can't really recommend it to anyone in its current form.  Every new update brings little more than added hurdles and hoops for players to jump through to get the new and often OP gear. Its starting to get a point where there is a grind just to get the the actual gear grind, which then requires some new resource that can only be collected or awarded in some awkwardly arbitrary way (like random alert mission rewards). Its just getting a bit silly, and obvious to most that its to purposefully extend the grind time in order to encourage people to drop real cash instead.   Overall its not a bad game by any stretch, especially for a free to play title. Just dont expect to be able to dip in for short blasts of fun every now and then. If you're not in it for the long haul then expect to drop real cash to get the things you want.

I used to recommend this to every friend, now, not a chance. DE got greedy to an extreme. This game is one of the largest wastes of time you could invest in. Despite the fact that the sci-fi elements are intriguing, and promise a feeling of exploration and satisfaction, it satiates neither thirst. The game instead reduces the player to hacking and slashing, or firing guns blazing at hordes of faceless and uninspired 3D models, that don't deserve the title of enemy. They run and shoot towards you blindly, almost as blindly as you attack them, to an insignificant goal. Your rewards are next to none, assuming you don't invest over 150 hours a week (in which case this game may satisfy your urge for bland weaponry). If you so desire either weapons or new 'warframe' suits, then you must resort to dedicating your career to this abomination or you must purchase the over-priced 'platinum' currency. 'For only $15 USD this single weapon could be yours!' is a paraphrase of their store's radio jingle.   If you desire a pitfall in your life, then by all means sacrifice your wife and child's well-being to grind for that new 'warframe' suit, but if not, don't subject yourself to the boredom and microtransactions.

I love the fact that Warframe is a social game. Unless you're kind of crazy, most of the missions require a group to complete properly, and random grouping is easy and friendly. Lots of people in the chat are willing to help out newbies, and the community seems overall very friendly. The game is beautiful, with a sleek and clean space-age aesthetic that is a lot of eye candy. There really is a Warframe for everyone, with a variety of looks, feels, builds and abilities that are as fun as they are variable. There's still a lot of small glitches here and there (not being able to see the color of another player's ship is a current one) but nothing that impacts real gameplay, so that is truly a nit-pick more then a criticism. Overall, if you love a fun flash and bash space ninja game, this is really the one for you.

After playing this game for almost 2 years for over a 1000 hours i can safely say that it's a lot of fun! If you don't plan to play it for long as a free to play player.  Ok don't get me wrong, you can get EVERYTHING a paid user can get with literally no exceptions thanks to the trading system. You can trade paid currency and many in game item blueprints and mods as you like. This allows free to play users to earn paid currency.  However if you're going this route expect to farm 24/7 for the rest of your life. I'm one of the Founders of this game and i own the highest prime access pack which give the highest value for money paid currency. Yet i still haven't managed to 100% this over all my hours of playtime.   Good News Though, unless you're a crazy collector like me, you'll never have to. You can easily get proper gear you like within a week or two of playing.  I cannot stress enough how much care and love was put into this game, the updates are more frequent than i'v seen in any game ever. Adding a bunch of new maps,warframes,guns,cosmetics and a ton of other stuff. It is the most space ninja game you're gonna get with an ♥♥♥ ♥♥♥♥ing ton of content.   I recommend this game to it's fullest! It has it's flaws obviously... it can be pretty buggy at times but that's to be expected with constant updates, thankfully the bugs are dealt with rapidly but new ones will still come around. It is pretty grindy in it's nature and there are timewalls on crafting but they are no problem whatsoever once you have sated your lust for your first gear.  What i do not recommend however is buying weapons or warframes directly from the in game store, the prices are really high and they're that way on purpose. You're really intended to craft them, that's how i got 95% of my gear. However if you are into costumizing your looks, well you're in luck. The prices for cosmetics in this game are very resonable and with the daily chance to get a 25% , 50% or 75% discount on the paid currency you can end up with a ton for dirt cheap.  Warframe.. The Space Ninja Simulator RECOMMENDED

My Review:  Pros: - Lots of customization - Plenty of Warframes with unique abilities to choose from - Lots of weapons that all seem unique in their own way - A progression system that doesn't feel like such a slow grind  (As far as obtaining most materials, or leveling weapons and warframes) - Helpful/Friendly community - Fun movement mechanics - Intense combat - Space Ninjas  Cons: - Doesn't really do a good job of directing you to obtainable goals/what you should be doing to progress in the game (You just kinda have to wing it and figure stuff out as you go) - Having to wait long periods of time to craft something - Platinum to dollar ratio is inflated  (You have to spend big to get anything good from the marketplace) - Alert Missions not paying out what they say they would upon completion (Which can be frustrating when you were getting something you really wanted/needed for completing it)  Overall, I enjoyed the game even with all of the negative things I noticed about it. As far as FTP goes, it's one of the best out there.  Plus, it's based in the Dark Sector universe. Which is freaking awesome.  (I know they've never officially confirmed it, but come on. Even if it's not based in the exact universe, there are so many nods towards their older game that it's rediculous.)  If you're looking for a free game to play, give it a try. It can be played without paying any money pretty easily. It just takes longer to do anything. Plus if you supplement this game with a little cash every once in a while, it's very enjoyable.

So, I've been playing Warframe for a while now and I can honestly say it is an awesome game. For a free to play game it has great graphics, great gameplay, a good variety of things to do and an absolute ton of optional progression available.  At the start, options can be a liitle limited and the game doesn't direct new players that well, but if you stick with it you will be greatly rewarded.  To start with you only have 3 warframes to choose from and once chosen you are locked to that frame and the weapons you selected. And at first, when you look to see what other gear you can get, you would be forgiven for thinking it is a pay to win game, due to all the gear that (at first glance) can only be bought by platinum (which can only be bought with real money). However, after playing for a while I found that you can in fact unlock all frames and weapons ingame, by finding or buying (with ingame credits) blueprints, then crafting them with components you find on missions and drops, etc. There are some cosmetic items that can only be acquired via platinum, but nothing in terms of functional gear. Platinum merely removes the process of finding, crafting, and to some degree upgrading, the items you want.  It has, in my opinion, a perfect cash shop system. While the progression can be slow, the game is so much fun to play it doesn't feel grindy. The combat is great, the parkour movement system is a lot of fun and there is a large variety of weapon and frame options to choose from, which you can swap around between missions. There is a good selection of mission types available and each mission tileset is randomized.  I have not tried the PvP side of things in this game yet, so I do not know how balanced it is (some frames can get crazy powerful), but the PvE side of things is great fun, both solo and with allies.  The polish in Warframe is excellent and I really like the organic artstyle the game has. It is a game that will appeal to both casual and hardcore players alike, and that is no mean feat. And on top of that the devs clearly have a lot of passion for their game, and do regular patch and content updates.  Warframe is my join most played game currently, along with Guild Wars 2 and Fallout 4, and I can see myself continuing to play it for a long time to come.  Because the devs are clearly doing their best to improve and add to the game, and because the gameplay, aesthetics, variety and progression are all top notch, I am happy to rate this game 10 out of 10, and would recommend it to anyone who enjoys fast paced scifi action games. And who wouldn't enjoy playing as a badass space ninja?

Just thought I should make a quick review for this game, as I think it really deserves it. I've been playing for over 500 hours (played before I added it to steam), and have enjoyed every hour of it. I got to see the amazing growth of this game from its basic UI and launcher, to a now more sophisticated experiance. Make no mistake, this game is really easy to understand, now more than ever since they updated the tutorial. (Again I witnessed the first tutorial and am loving the changes its gone through). Before, the UI was very limited and cubic. Now you have your own ship, or liset, that is custom to your preference. They added new companions known as Kubrows. Before you had small robots who followed you around doing their own abilites to help you. However, dont think people still dont use them. They are just as used as the dogs are. As for the actual Warframes, you can't complain. They have made over a dozen warframes to choose from. Those who like tanking(like me) choose Rhino or Frost. DPS? Ember. Healing? Trinity. Each have their own unique abilities to suit every kind of player out there. There is a large disccusion still going on on the fact that Warframe has been known to being a Pay 2 Play. I'm here to say that that is not true. Yes, Platinum (Purchased currency) has its obvious advantages, but not many. In fact, you can get anything you want in-game, even if it does cost Plat. How you ask? The magic of trading. Your eventually going to get stuff others want, and they'll pay you Plat for it. And if you don't feel like waiting, farm it. Most farming in-game can actually be a lot of fun, especially if your with a friend. And for those of you who are worried about loot drops being for only one person of your team, don't worry, all loot can be picked up by everyone.(So WoW fans you can calm down). In conclusion I give this game a 10/10. But don't take my word for it, go try it yourself.

So, I've been playing this game for a while now and finnally thought I should review it. Lets get right into it shall we?  First off, lemme just say that this game, for being free, is really well optimized at least for my and my friend's rigs. The graphics overall as well are REALLY nice especially being a free game. I know that there are some other free games that have amazing graphics but this one (atleast for me) takes the cake. Now there have been some graphical glitches I've ran into but they're usually pretty minor. Speaking of glitches, this game MOST DEFINITLY has its fair share lemme tell ya. However, most of them usually get patched out the next hotfix so it's not that bad. There are also some hilarious ones so thats always a good laugh. As far as gameplay goes, this game wins it for me as well. The time and care that DE puts into each frame is amazing. Each frame is unique, has its own style and abilities. Even further from that the amount of weapons added into this mix makes it that much better. Then when you add in the mods, it makes the list of customization and amount of playstyles so much longer.  Now for the few cons: Platinum. Need I say more? Well actually, I don't really have an issue with plat it's just expensive and I'm poor (from buying plat fml) Only reason I'm okay with it is because it supports the constant updates (and by constant I mean almost weekly).  Wait time. Theres a lot of it. Just get ready to wait for stuff you want. On average it takes most weapons 12-24 hours to make, warframe parts take 12 and the warframe takes a whopping 73 hours to craft. It's not bad persay but I still find it annoying even if it is to balence the game.   Other than this I cant really think of any other personal complaints I have with the game, really. Overall I would highly recommend this game to someone that likes PvE with some PvP games (sorta like Destiny I guess?) It's really a great game to sit down witha few friends and play the hell outta for an hour or two.   See you in combat, Tenno

Here's what I have to say about Warframe in the time that I played it.  This game is the best free to play I've seen yet. Why?  1) Everything you earn in this game can be earned for FREE. As long as you have the time. If you feel like rushing an item in forge, etc. etc., you can ourchase credits to get that item on the spot. So spending money is completely optional. (Plus, the grind to get items leaves a much more satisfying taste once you finally get said item.)   2) Warframe is updated daily. Always a good thing. The more the merrier.  3) Gameplay is SOLID. Movements in this game are nice and crisp. I'm always doing some wild maneuvers that make me feel like a badass. Quality is a plus, especially for a free to play.  The only con I have is that I encountered a bug where I could not see anything on my screen but my game was still running. So I had to find the exit button to close the game. But after that, everything worked fine. Also, it is a bit hard to understand how everything works in the game at first. The game just throws you in. They have tutorials in the codex, but I don't think it's enough. However, I learned as I started to play more and research.  I highly recommend this game to anybody who wants to have fun. (Hopefully that's everybody lol.)

Two words. Space ninjas. In all sincerity though, Warframe is an excellent title, it has great gameplay, smooth visuals, and works well even on somewhat older computers. Being a free to play game, you'd figure there would be 'pay to win' items using micro-transactions. While micro-transactions do play a part in this game, it is entirely co-op, not competetive, so you aren't going to get wiped on the floor by someone because they shelled out some cash for goodies, because they will always be on YOUR team. And every equipable item in the marketplace that can be bought with premium cash can be crafted using blueprints, which you can buy in the marketplace for in-game credits. There are even some items only available through finding the blueprints for them in missions. All in all, Warframe is an amazing co-op experience, and while the game is technically still in beta and has a few bugs and glitches here and there, the developers are always on top of the situation, and regularly converse with members on the forums to weed them out. I would definitely reccomend a quick download of this game right away. After all, NINJAS PLAY FREE!!! :D

Its a Free to Play Game with Space Ninjas!  On a more serious note, I have played this back in Update 9 (Crrently in U17) and left becasue none of my friends would play it and I was rather lost and alone, (#LoneTenno). However, a few weeks back my friends mentioned this game and I was very excited to get people to play and BOOM,.... The game hit me like a god damn 18 wheeler in the face coming back to my old account not knowing anything or what to do at all!!! (Ahhh the joys of being a newb....). So I did whAT ANY SANE PERSON WOULD DO... START FROM SCRATCH AND i HAVE BEEN HAVING A BLAST!  SSERIOUSLY TRY THIS GAME! 10/10  F2P ASPECT: Asthetics- Cash out the Dough - (However some holidays they offer free asthetics like facial hair and colo palettes)  Weapons - Farm/Cash out the dough - (Honestly just farm it out the flow of the game makes it fun as you grind away)  Characters (AKA Warframes)- Farm/Cash out the dough (Farm yet again.... unless its a Warframe that is nearly impossible to get, *cough* Ash *Cough*)  Rare Items - Farm/cash out the dough (again just farm, you never know, maybe while farming for the other materials you will get the item you want)  Lives - Cash out the dough/ DONT DIE/ wait for reload/ change warframe -   So in a day, your character has four live and once they are up you cannot revive anymore, so if you are in a mission and die, you are forced to abort. BUT revives are on a per Warframe basis so if you have 2 Warframes each 'frame has 4 lives.  Now for the worst part of the entire F2P model  INVENTORY SLOTS FOR WEAPONS AND WARFRAMES  ok, so slots cost 20 platinum (($1.33 USD) premium currency, must pay or trade to get).  Each slot can hold 1 weapon and same goes for the warframe slots.   HOWEVER DESPITE ALL THIS CASHING OUT THE DOUGH....You can FARM 4 PLATINUM!!!!!!  Platinum (Plat.) is the premium currency within warframe but its not excludded form the Warframe economy. SO a player may farm to get rare parts or mods to sell for platinum to wallet warriors within the community!.  there is alot more to go over but......I think this enough for a new player to learn anymore and it might be too much info to read soooo JUST PLAY THE GAME ALREADY!!!!!!!  Tenno out of 10

Review time, honestly this game is brilliant. I don't think I have been captured as much by a game as I was Warframe for a very long time. The combat feel's great, the diversity in weapons/suits is awesome and each tends to feel different to use, especially in the case of Warframes. The nature of the game always gives you something to do without feeling like you're being punished for playing F2P if that's your scenario, it's really a pay for convinence rather then pay to win in any scenario. The only thing locked behind a pay wall is cosmetic stuff and even then you can trade in game for platinum (The purchasable resource) off other players in the late stages of the game.   The game is easy to pick up and play and looks and feels like the sci-fi game I always wanted. I honestly think this is one of the best free to play titles I've had the pleasure of sinking some time into. That said while you can easily sink tons of hours at a time into this game I would very much recommend that you don't burn it out too quickly, the content is not limitless in nature. While at end game there is always something to keep you occupied if you wish it, burning through the available missions in a few weeks is not advised in my opinion. Take your time and enjoy the game and it will last you ten times longer.

(This will most likely be my most comprehensive review yet.)  Warframe is a complicated game. I've been giving this game a break for about a while or so; and I recently got back into it, today in fact. I was reminded why I ditched the game for a while now. My first match, I was supposed to hack and then protect some terminals on a quest(The New Strange, Eris.). I failed due to the position being compromised. I decided afterwards, why not level up my cute kubrow(Its a dog, and they are adorable.)? He was incubating. In other words, I'd have to wait a few real-world days to use him. I decided after that, why not level up m new gun, Karak Wraith? I went into Apolladorus, Mercury, and I had a glitch where the camera was in my character. I couldn't properly see anything, so I had to quit fairly on, only reason I survived as long as I did was because my shots could instant kill the low level enemies.   Originally, I loved Warframe. (Just look at my play-time!) But now, the gameplay feels stale, I've slaughtered everything, I've cut down every faction, I've done the quests, participated in events, so many things.   But whats to do when you've done everything?  If you want to play a relatively fun MMO, give Warframe a chance. Just don't play it to death.  EDIT: 7/11/2015  Yeesh, that review was terrible. I'll keep it there to remind your fine self as well as myself that this game can indeed get old; but any game can get old. Using a game getting repetative is a terrible point in a review(Unless the game gets old very quickly; in which case its justified.).   Warframe does not fit that criteria. It took me hundreds of hours to get bored; and those hours were magical. I made friends, made a clan, made enemies, freed the solar system from its oppressors, slew a race of assimilating hive mind controlled monsters, blew up giant robots managed by a corrupt CEO and board, and impaired a xenophobic army. I uncovered mysteries long thought lost, revitalized a warframe long thought lost. I even flew through space on a jetpack and shot down massive ships with my bros and avenged our fallen comrades who were struck down by those same ships.   I love this game. No amount of burn out or boredom will keep me from loving it. Why? Well, besides the the memories mentioned above, i've never seen a developer who loved their creation so much; this game receives content updates far more often; Update 17 is right around the corner, and I am pumped for that.   Only thing I should suggest ahead is it'd be ideal(Not a requirement) to bring a friend in with you, but thats an MMO thing. EDIT 2: 3/13/2016  Just finished the Second Dream questline. Yup. This game is the best MMO i've ever played. EDIT 3: 6/7/2016   Its been a while and Digital Extremes has pumped out quite a few new bits fo content, but fans still eagerly await the next massive update. The pressure, it seems, was too much for Digital Extremes. In their plight to please fans, they have created quite the community controversy. Namel, by nerfing characters. Mirage and Exacaliber, who both previously had some of the best ultimates in the game, now have had their ults nerfed in the form of lowering Exlated Blade's damage, its distance, and giving it damage falloff(It loses damage over the distance it travels.), Mirage now can only confine her ultimate to her line sight(It used to clear out rooms and made raids slightly less likely to end in people bashing their skulls into their keyboards.), which makes her ult completely pointless as now Mirage will have to brazenly rush into enemy fire, and probably die since she's caster frame, just to fire off her ult. Next we have the healer, Trinity, who's ult was making friendlies all over the map become invinicble for a bit. Now, Blessing will only work if allies are in your immediate vicinty, as in 25 meters or more. This doesn't sound bad, until you go into a T4 Survival and you're running low on oxygen, and your teams needs to split up. Your bro is with Trin, and you're with a Dead Eye Mesa, then a Corrupted Bombard and Corrupted Nullifer come in, now Blessing won't save you, now nothing will. Next, we have the fan favorite Valkyr, the beserker frame, who has the incredibly awesome ult of Hysteria, which also makes you invincible(Gee, almost makes you think DE shouldn't have gone for tons of invincible ults...) and turns you into a real beserkers as Valkyr gets epic energy claws and cuts Corpus Combat Engineers to ribbons. Now, her ult rapidly drains the more energy it goes on. Now, Valkyr's ult is great as Valkyr's highest stat is armor, not health or shields. Hysteria gave her a change to regen her shields, as well as revive allies in sticky situations while she's under fire. In addition to the cost, the moment she leaves Hysteria and there's an enemy nearby, she's screwed.  TL;DR:   These nerfs have ruined many incredibly popular frames, divided the community once again. These literally could have been fixed any day for three years now. The fact they do this now, right before a major update, just makes it worse as it seems like they're padding out the wait, and adding in an inflamation of artifical difficulty. I run this game on a toaster laptop, and I prfer to solo, usually with Trinity Prime, as I love her to death. Now unfortanately, the blessing build I used before due to her poor stats, now she can only die a lot.   Finally, sorry for the long read, but that summerize my thoughts on the latest 'Bug fix' quite well. DE has nerfed many characters that made soloing far more bearable, and totally I unistalled the game. The game is great for anyone new, but older players may find themselves at a great disadvantage with the new changes, and may wish to change their warframes.  Overall, this stays a positive as only a few frames were changed, but it still stands a probelem with Digital Extremes that they have to face this problem of seemingly random nerfs, or explain themselves accordingly. EDIT 4: 7/14/2016  Trying to keep this review up to date. Three Days ago, they released Specters of the Rail, otherwise known as 'The Fanbase splits apart for the millionth time!'This time for a slightly more legit reason: Removal of the Void and the new system, Void Fissures. Oh, and Kavats. And hopefully soon, Titania and The War Within quest. If I remember this review exists, i'll update it as I continue exploring the latest update.
