For over four years, with a fully operational cash shop and unlock times that either force you to play dozen of hours just to unlock a single weapon or suit or pay them money for it. I'm not in the mindset to pay real money for virtual items especially in a multiplayer game whose player base will eventually move on, making my purchases moot. Unlike with an MMO that has an upkeep cost, this game has no such things to worry about as far as I know.   Pros: -Runs on lower end systems pretty easily -Fun in short bursts  Cons: -Grindy as hell, takes forever to earn anything outside of buying it with real money -Odd glitches and bugs still pop up constantly from being unable to revive teamates to your HUD locking in place  Only get if you have a massive amount of time to spare or massive amounts of money you want to throw away. The biggest thing I regret while writing this review is that I genuinely want to like this game, I really do! I originally heard about it from this MMO site's 'Free to Play MMO showdown', in which Warframe and my beloved MMO of choice Mabinogi were the final contestants. This game won by a small handful of votes and I honestly cannot for the life of me see why with some of the glaring flaws it has.  Let's talk about new players. You literally need them and need them to stay to make your MMO thrive. So why is Warframe so damn HOSTILE towards them? First, you only get to choose from three of the 30+ warframes. On top of that, they're incredibly weak warframes. Now I understand that part. You're a newbie, you're not supposed to start out ripped as hell. But there's basically no diversity in the choice. 'Oh, there's no role you're comfortable with amongst these three playstyles? Too bad! Grind to hell and back, give us your money, or go screw yourself!'. And on top of that, the game explains nothing but the very raw basics at the beginning. Had I not had several friends who were already experienced with this game, I would have quit sooner. And don't even bother asking strangers for help, you'll either be completely blown off or completely made fun of!  And speaking of friends, don't bother trying to play with them! You'll disconnect at least five times under the guise of 'transferring hosts' before you decide that putting up with the constant disconnection either isn't worth it or until your friends just finish the mission without you.  Oh, and apparently there are 'wrong' weapon choices, too. If you don't pick the best weapons the tutorial can provide, you're basically screwed for the first several HOURS of the game. Especially when you want to rank up. And even when you CAN get a new weapon? You have to put up with arbitrary grinding and the game's ungodly crafting system. Seriously, an entire damn day for one new gun? THREE days for a new warframe? Not even counting all the hours you have to grind for the necessary materiels and having to craft each individual parts of said warframe first? I haven't seen a crafting system with such BS arbitrary wait times since Phantasy Star Online 2. And even then it has redeeming qualities to make up for it!  The entire line of progression is basically 'grind and sit on your butt while waiting, give us your money, or ♥♥♥♥ off'. This game shows so much potential! But according to older players the developers of this game have squandered it not once, but TWICE.

I was really enjoying Warframe until I got a quest to get an Archwing. To do this I had to go to Venus, find sites where blueprints are buried and then defend an excavation unit as it unearths one. There are four different blueprints needed to build an Archwing. As you do this enemies spawn constantly and it seems to me that the level gets progressively more difficult the longer you are there. The annoying part comes when you realise that whatever blueprint you get is random, I've played this level repeatedly and keep getting the same two blueprints. Also you need to kill certain enemies to get energy that's needed to power the excavators and the game has refused to spawn these enemies for me, leaving me with no option but to exit the level immensely frustrated. I can understand random loot drops but not for quest items, this mechanic seems to be a negative consequence of the game being free to play and it's a pity because there is something truly special here otherwise. Anyone that enjoys third person shooters/ melee and doesn't mind tedious grinding or paying to skip it will have a better experience.

Games vary on what you are into. Some people mindlessly shoot people like in COD or Battlefield. Others enjoy platforming like the Homie Crash, Ratchet and Clank and Jak and Daxter. Some enjoying grinding for what they want so they can earn it. Others simply want rewards whenever they feel like or want it as soon as they find out about it. This game is a combination of most of these things. I personally consider this as a 3rd person Platformer shooter with Grind fest^34th. Its more than just ninjas in space. Your tools truly do shape you. You go in there with a halfmodded class, youre gonna have to work your ♥♥♥ off in order to not die and keep up with your friends. Go in there with actual modding setup, you'll be able to hold your own and even half play while you text your girl about spring break plans (Sorry, didnt mean to sound objective) Unless you put in the time to properly prepare and some research to crunch numbers on what build is most effective agasint what with what team composition. The gameplay itself is fun, sure some frames can use similar abilities or nowhere near similar abilities to reach the same result, ♥♥♥♥ dying or getting from point a to ledge b for example. There are dozens of weapons and while theres a significant bit that are garbage or have unrealistic standards for making the weapon, theres still a crapton of weapons that are effective and plainly just FUN. I've been playing this since Update 9 during Ember prime access on console all the way to Update 13 or 14, took a break, came over to pc RIGHT before the chroma update. So I'm not some dude who came through during the tailend of stuff, I've been around for AWHILE so I can honestly take appreciation for all the changes and advances in the mechanics, bullet jump is awesome. Outside of Gameplay, the story you have to string together yourself. READ EVERYTHING. The codex entries, the dialogue the bosses havem, pay attention during the quests and whatever else Lotus (Space Mom) says to you. From a writers standpoint, the story was ok and has vass amount of potential until Update 18.0. The big Reveal in the quest 'The Second Dream' For Update 18.0 was lame, made many plot holes, and disappoints many. Alot of people don't have the patience to piece together the story and so many don't see the problem with the plot twist but imagine that you put in the time and effort and the research to actually know whats going on and why every alien species/factions are afraid of you and hate you. Imagine putting forth the initiative only for the biggest sack of disappointment to where you literally say 'Ooook this is getting stupid'. Imagine getting that middle finger to the face about the claim of everything being canon even though the lore is stabbed in multiple parts and has stab wounds known as plot holes. Imagine the fact the director of this warframe project , Steve Sinclair, replies to criticism about this plot hole like a snobby 5 year old. He doesnt take criticism well so when he is told that his creation wasnt thought out very well and doesnt make sense, he's gonna be a prick about it. He doesnt go as far as to ban you or block you but he will make you reconsider coming to him for help. As a whole, we've witnessed Steve Sinclair And Rebecca Ford go at it because as the community manager Rebecca gets paid to know how we are and our thoughts towards things that need to be changed or improved upon. Steve can't accept that the things he does arent 100% full proof so its an uphill battle for Ford. Sorry for the ranting, just wanted to make this as honest as possible. Gameplay is good, Grinding is insanely high and sometimes broken, Story was good until the garbage 'Plot twist' known as the 2nd dream. If you don't care about story and can deal with not getting that thing you want anywhere from 8 hours to 2 months later, by all means, play this game my friends.

definitely a good one of course as free to plays go it has its flaws but if your a kid with no wallet and have nothing better to so then this could be a fun time sponge. however if you have a wallet you might want to hold onto it very closely cause you may find the gameplay so exhilirating that you buy everything. which is fine supports the game but i often times found myself spending too much just to progress faster . there is pvp but the game's main focus is primarily co op play of missions and attempting to become the most badass looking guy ever which is what pvp is for not really designed in fairness more in showing your prowess of attained power and skill. the flying missions i felt need more depth to them sometimes they're just fustrating and boring but its definatley fun to be a robo ninja drop kicking enemies while firing volleys into massive teams of enemies following you into rooms. the rooms are randomly generated which is sometimes good sometimes bad especially if you get a glitch but more often than not the devs are listening to get that fixed. if your impatient and don't want to pay this will annoy you since makiing new things takes a lot of grinding and a few days to create i simply decided that i play every once in a while and stop playing to wait for the things to be built and do other things so i'd say its a good game but take in small doses of the hype may destroy your wallet but then agan don't forget the occasional purchase all goes towards helping keep the game and its servers afloat. it is free afterall.

I used to enjoy this game. And let me be clear; I've been playing since the closed beta testing. This game used to hold a small universe full of creatures that were not clearly defined as good or evil. Over time, this changed from a well done shooter game, to a badly written Emmnite Shamamalama script.   Upon playing through the update for the second dream, I realized that even though so much of this game is extremely well done, there are quite a few mind breaking ideas that just defy the continuity of their own universe.   I will not go into spoilers, however it will suffice to say that whoever wrote the ending to the quest did not understand human ideals as a species.  If you're looking for a good way to pass time, then this is a game for you.  However, if you're looking for an interesting storyline, beleivable motives, and a good naritive, then this is not a game you should be playing.

The game Warframe, although with great graphics, concept, and plotline, seem to lacking severly in one area: leting the computer 'walk away' from the game. The problem is, this game eats up a whopping 2200 MB of RAM, which many (if not all) computers cannot handle. This causes the game to SEVERLY lag during missions and even with all the settings turned off or set to low, still consumes 1900 MB. I personaly would LOVE to enjoy the game, but I simply cannot with all of the issues with lag and uneven framerate. Even after you leave the game, the game script continues to run until you manualy shut it down by using the task manager. In short, great game, horrible lag.

One of the most boring and ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ games ever. It's so grindy that it ought to be criminal, unless you're a millionare don't bother with this strictly pay2notgrind game. All the ninja feels go out the window, the tilesets and the enemies are all the sames, you literally have like 7 enemy models, the lore is almost non-existent, it's not going to be any better because the majoriy share in DE is Chinese, and you know what penny pinchers they are.

Warframe is highly based around CO-OP. This game becomes very tedious if you do not have friends to play with you. Grinding is also a factor in this game, but of course, this being a F2P game, the game let's you buy pass the grinding with $$$.    Character Customization is expansive, with a varity of cosmetics to choose from, inluding animation style for your Character. Howevery, I do find it ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ty that the game makes you buy colors.   Combat depends on the people playing, but you're more likelyto encounter Grinders are more likely to rush to the objective and complete the mission. There are a varity of Weapons to mow down enemies with as well as mods to make them even more powerful.   Story is not that bad if you pay attention to it. There are some intresting concepts that caught my eye.   There is stealth in this game, but it's really crappy so if you're gonna try, do it solo or with friends.   As I said, this game is boring without friends to play it with. Now why not use pubilc? Because it's kinda crappy. You have to set up a game first, go into the public chat and start recuiting and then start. Jumping into the middle of a mission is doesn't always workout to well and there's also the fact that there are some connecting and syncing issues that still need to be worked out.   Overall I give this game a 7/10 (Great Game). Warframe still has some flaws to work out but it's still a good game. Just, get yourself some friends to play with before you start. Otherwise, you will be very, very lonely.

Warframe. It's fun, but it's not without a few flaws.  Good: Well, for one it's free, but not a bad kind of free game either. You can get pretty much anything worthwhile in game without spending a penny, so there is always the truly cheap option here. That aside, the gameplay is fun when it works. Join in with other robot-alien ninja in random multiplayer co-op and blast through missions. Use super powers, unlock more powers and upgrades, get levels, get more upgrades, get new stuff, etc. It all works pretty well for this fast-paced shoot n' slash adventure. Environments are fun and interesting for a good while, and while there is a bit of grind at least you'll have a fun time doing it. After playing through the same missions a few times I just never got wore out of anything.  Combat is flexible and varied, there is a unique class system with powers being tied to your armor, an impressive arsenal of weapons can be tweaked with mods as you go to fit your tastes, bosses are interesting and challenging, and it's got a nice setting set in a future solar system space world. And, again, it doesn't cost anything to player.  Bad: Easily summarized. Grinding. There is a LOT of grinding here. You've got to get materials and credits to make things for free (more a problem for the former), and once you do there is a 12 hour timer to antagonize your attempts to get free weapons. Materials you need for new stuff aren't readily available, so if you want anything other than the starting rifle early on you'll have to buy. Things seem expensive for an ftp though (or maybe I don't know jack about ftp economies). Also, there is a limit on how much stuff you can actually carry, so there is that expected required buy-in if you want more inventory space for new guns and the like; otherwise you have to sacrifice your old stuff. At least that's not very expensive. As far as actual gameplay, there are only a few types of enemies, and the environments are a little repetitive despite how well made they are. For all the tools and toys you get, there aren't a whole lot of places and things to use them on.  Just lots of the same places, and lots of time you need to spend to get anything. Grind grind grind. Loot loot loot. Do it all again. That's all there is to it.  Overall: It's definitely grind-heavy and repetitive, and if either of those things annoy you then don't expect to like this one.  But none of that gets in the way of some cool gameplay and general good multiplayer fun. If you are looking for a quick action game that you can easily jump into and play without putting a hole in the wallet, then there is a lot to like here. At the very least, it IS free, so what is there to lose? Give it a try. I recommend it.

Even though I'm not that good at this game, I still enjoy it.   The survival, the stealth, the missions in-general! It's all so perfect and it fits this world which was created.  AND! It's free! This Warframe LOOKS beautiful and the gameplay is fluent, the parkour element can be irritating yet it still works when you use it correctly.   However, most say this game is P2W -- I respectfully disagree, as some items you can pay for, you can simply craft the items when you have a blueprint, I found a Banshee Chassis and Paris bow blueprints, which is pretty good.   The Tenno you can play as add a whole new, not very complex but again, extremely fluent gameplay.  You can go to the very well balanced Excalibur, the first. Electrocute your enemies with Volt, fry them -- LITERALLY! You can also crush your enemies with Mag, again -- quite literally. Ram through a barrage of Grineer with Rhino! Turn invisible and move behind your enemies with an advantage, create a energy created duplicate of yourself to distract enemies to get an advantage as Loki!   These are five Tenno from many more, it's extremely lovely to have so many options but that can irritate you also, you always must think about what Tenno is good for what! Excalibur is a mostly all-round Tenno, Rhino -- I would say is pretty offense to me, there are so many options it's amazing.   I would actually never think to remove this game or decide not to play it, I give it a 9/10 with a seal of badassery, a must own game. Get it.

Just put more time in and completed the Tor Treasure mission chain for removing the bomb you get infused with. After this the game goes open do w/e. if by do what you want you mean buy blueprints that you have no idea are good or not, grind mission over and over farming materials to craft that weapon. hope it was a strong weapon, use that to grind amterials for stronger weapons. Rinse repeat, rinse repeat. If you've played CABAL (another free MMO) this is the ninja robot CABAL for more powerful computers. You grind repeatable missions, for mats to build gear, to grind harder repeatable missions, to do the same. if you're looking for an RPG, go somewhere else, this is a F2P grind fest  Just another F2P with limited functionaltiy and unforgiving (thoughtless entry) once you as a new player make a class decision. You can not undo it, make a new guy etc... YOu're stuck with the decisions you make during the tutorial (apparently some weapon choices are MUCH MUCH better then others. Lets say you chose excalibur and went with the Bo Staffm well two things, you have to wait ages to get the sword you could have had (while the Bo staff is easily buyable with in game currency, the sword is not. Instant regret decisions you can't redo with a new toon. Lets say you didnt' want the excalibur class, well too bad, so sad, until you grind insane amounts in game to unlock other warframes/classes you're stuck with it. No starting over, no new guy. No start overs... While these decisions can be corrected witg 20-40 hours of gameplay (or immediate REAL CASH transaction) chances are as a new player you are immediately turned off by the game.  I know I am. Worthless tutorials in game, so you go to you tube and find out you made all the wrong choices, and you hav to dredge through 20-40 of crap to get what you wanted and start leveling that all over..... If a content creator doesn't care enough to let you start over from scratch or teach you anything about the game beyond WASD - Run - Jump and Mouse click, but also couples the learning curve with irreversible decisions. they don't deserve my vote or game time.  Pro's ------ it's shiny 90% of the cash shop is obtainable with in game grinding  Con's ----- crude global chat where you get Zero help only ridicule ridiculous lack of tutorial or effective explanation of what is supposed to be basic functions like EQUIPPING GEAR thoughtless and punishing early character design for new players Cash shop sells boosts and gear  My No vote is based on first impressions. Some people like strong moldy cheeses, but that's an acquired taste, this game is an acquired taste. I'm sure if I was to dump 40 hours in to it I may START to enjoy it. But a game shouldn't take 40 hours to get enjoyable

-Game is far too repetitive and doesnt have much going for it other than the weapons.  -This game revolves around the 'grind for hours on end to make 1 to 2 things' formula  -Having to wait 8 to 78 hours (real time) to make just 1 item is absurd and to think they wanted me to pay real money for in-game currency to shorten that time is terrible. Acts like a phone game.  -Melee is completely thoughtless it is just mash E until the enemy is dead and there is no form of strategy  -The guns are cool but take hours and some might take days to make. Also there could have been many more creative weapons especially more creative silent weapons other than the generic throwing knives and bows (which are actually the only silent weapons in the game. There are no silent guns or silent lasers that I know of.)  -The mods are cool although i wish there was a larger variety of mods instead of getting the same duplicates over and over  -Grinding was a pain because you would be doing different mission types but on the same map for each planet  -Stealth is only sub-par since the ai is blind and crouching is %100 pointless  -Stealth is not very rewarding due to no sneak dmg bonus or anything exciting  -Game is EXTREMLY glitchy and I exited the map multiple times within the first hour of playing.  -Dead bodies constanly glitch around from weapons with a large amount of impact  -The AI moves in such a poor pattern it is the equivalent of fighting mindless zombies. (there is no thought to them) I went against the AI they would take cover in plain sight. Some would run into walls. Some would be turned around starting at a wall while I was sneaking around. Some would slowly walk straight towards me or even avoid the 'strength in numbers' tactic. In games like this I want AI that is difficult because they are naturally difficult and not be difficult just because they are leveled up above the player.  -The game controls feel completely off with the keyboard but they dont feel much better with a controller either. I constantly found myself adjusting the controls and sensitivity just to get the right feeling but even then it felt like my mouse was on a slip and slide.  -The Warframes seemed to be really cool being able to cusomize the colors and all but note that ALL (but about 16 colors) were behind some form of pay wall. Even simple colors like black and white needed real money to be obtained.  -The three factions were pretty different from each other but the infested seemed a bit too easy.  -The small amount of pvp that I did felt completly meaningless although it was functional all I obtained were credits and no crafting materials. Not only that but there seemed to be nobody playing it unless it was because of my low ranking but even then I should have been able to find more than 1 game.  -There are limited inventory slots for weapons and warframes (armor) but the free inventory is super small and wants real money to be expanded to a thoughtful size.  -The community seemed to be mostly clean although I did not see many people typing in the regional and recruiting chat but I don't really think that can be judged or anything especially since I do not know the games playerbase. The only issue with the community is 1 guy that wanted to power level me from level 1 to whatever when I was still in my first hour of gameplay. Then he wouldn't leave me alone until I blocked him.  -Note that I only played for 24 hours and did not discover everything in the game.I also did not pay any real money.This review is just a hint on what you might encounter after your first few hours of gameplay.  ---Overall I feel the gameplay was decent but the missions were bad. I cannot give the game much more than a 6/10 and it is very ashamed because feeling of using a bow felt really fun and seeing the arrows fling people was also nice but the games missions and constant glitches kept me board. The only times I had fun was when I was trying to sneak around but the ai is so mediocre it made stealth way too easy. I dont feel that I can really recommend this game even though it is free, but if you have a lot of time on your hands that you want to throw out the window then this game will do it. Just prepare to be bored after an hour of playing. I also did not get a companion or archwing because I got too bored to continue the long grind.

I have hundreds of hours in Warframe.  I cannot in good conscience recommend it to anyone.  Warframe features some of the best moment to moment game play around. You truly take the role of one of many space ninjas. Exciting movement, gliding through the air, hacking and blasting and casting. Its exciting.  But the entire game is built completely around RNG. Everything is a grind. Warframes are obtained one piece at a time, from bosses. You just grind until each part drops once (average of 5 - 6 times total for three parts) and THEN you STILL buy the Blueprint from the market for in game currency.   And so it goes. All the best stuff in the game is free. It just requires hour and hours of endless RNG grind. Which wouldnt be so bad, except the game features a very limited selection of mission types, and in the late game forces you to run certain types for certain rewards - or, well, chances at rewards - whether you enjoy that type or not.   All of which is a shame. For a game this fun, with game play this exciting, to lean solely on RNG and exploitative business practices is a disappointment.

With Specters of the Rail, i have to change this to a Negative.. -  -The Archwing now makes anyone extremely motion sick, the controls are like driving a boat, in a 360 degree sphere, while stone drunk! Which ofcourse makes Aiming, very difficult, and melee no longer carries long combos, because targets only seem to be attacked, when in front of the player. Not to mention the Up the butt FoV! To top that off, we now must PAY for AW slots.. I spent 2 weeks prior to SotR farming every AW weapon, in order to better combat Jordas, to aquire Atlas. Since i didnt craft/claim them all, i now have to pay to use them.. Real money! Had i just accepted them prior, that would all be free! AW wasnt popular because rewards sucked, not because of controls.. And no ones going to pay for an unpopular, vomit inducing mode!  -The new map, while very astheticly pleasing, is not very intuitive. Theres no information that needs to be shown, and the nodes are tiny, and need to be hovered over, to find out what they are! It takes longer to access each panet, and node, as its so much larger.   -The market im 50/50 on. Its about the same, but hiding the BP behind Platinum was shady (has been fixed)  -The new Void Fissure system.. While i like being able to target things, and have 4 choices, were now using 4x more Relic/key than previously. No more key shares, and we now have MORE farming than ever! We now have dozens of kinds of relics, and ontop of those, must use Traces to increase drop chance of otherwise inaccessable parts. While we can all use 4 of the same relic, refined, theres no way to know if you have party members who are lying, or have even brought one, lessening the drop table for all.   -Then we have the fissure itself. A boring, tacked on, after thought! The exact same half ♥♥♥♥♥ extraction mission every. single. time. Compounded by Nullifiers, Bombardiers, and heavy gunners aglore, with low drop chance on the stupid put the ball in the hole game mode.. The old void maps were much better, and now have NO reason to go to it, other than, for the ONLY way to get Argon Crystals!  -Heavy Melee weapons now are immobile. When swingiong, it literally stop you in place, and enemies slowly walk backwards, safely staying out of range, all while pumping rounds into your character! I dont know why we needed pve changes, for the sake of pvp.. I HATE that!  -Tons of Bugs(yes theyll be fixed, but its worth mentioning, as this entire update was broken from top to bottom, and forced a complete revamp of majority of the game) its now so far less appealing, that many are abandoning the game.. I myself went from playing whenever i wasnt at work, to logging in, playing amatch or two, and logging out in disgust!  -Credits have been halved for rewards, Nullifiers buffed, Syndicate rep halved, and many resources seem to be far more difficult to obtain..(Ex: Oxium less drops, and i could swear Neurodes are deliberately avoiding me, because theyre what i most need. ive gotten 4 in the last 4 weeks)  -Veterans who had the entire solar system unlocked, find that they no longer hav fully unlocked planets, and must complete much of it again.  +Junctions.. I think these were neat, though i dont understand it from a lore persp[ective.. Whos controlling these tenno? Why are they fighting allied Tenno? -Still no tutorials, or explanations of ANYTHING! -To me, the difficulty seems to have spiked. Missions i used to steamrole, are now mopping the floor with me. I even died ina few missions in the late teens, early twenties! Theres plenty more, but its just overwhelming.. It went from a game i couldnt wait to get home and play, to a game that feels more like a chore.. The fun has been removed in many aspects.

This game has and will entertain me for some time to come, but I can not recommend you to get into this game as a new player.   Let’s start with the ninja theme. Its cool and all hopping up and down walls and throwing ninja stars and what not. But that's about as far as the Ninjaing goes. And you'd think that with mission types labeled as 'Assassination' and 'Spy' THere would be a good amount of stealth, right? WRONG! There is nothing in this game that can’t be brute forced with a little bit of speed and a good gun. The assassination missions are just kill/run past the dudes to fight a big dude, who is sometimes not a hard as the dudes who preceded them, and run to the exit. And the spy missions are more of the same. Kill/run past some guys, bruteforce a short stealth segment, and run to the end for loot.   As for the other mission types you have Extermination, Defence, Mobile Defence and interception. Extermination should be self explanatory, kill all the things. Defence is a gamemode where you defend a thing from the guys for 5 rounds and you repeat this 4 times for the best loot and bail. The mobile defence game mode is where you defend X points from the dudes all over the map and run to the exit when you’re done. And finally there’s Interception which is King of The Hill but with 4 points instead of 1.   Now luckily for us this game is early access beta and all of this will be fixed upon releasing their finished product.  Pfft, yeah right. This game has so much potential, or had. But somewhere DE started caring more about the money and less about their fans and product. They pay people to play their games and make their game look good, when there are blaring, obvious problems. Like recently they said they were trying to minimize grind so players didn’t get burned out. Now we are several updates past that and the grind is so much harder than before. It used to be you’d do a mission for a key that unlocked a special mission and you’d play that mission hoping for the reward you wanted. And you’d repeat that until you got the thing you wanted. Now you do a mission for a rock which unlocks a special mission and hope you get the reward you want. BUt now you can run more of these special rock missions to get another resource to alter the drop tables of these rocks and STILL not get the reward you wanted. Effectively not changing anything at best and at worst adding in more steps and more grind time.   Now how about we go on to the weapons. The weapons in this game are pretty fun. There’s a wide variety and something for almost anyone. Now there used to be a huge problem with weapon tiers, but with recent changes to the game almost any weapons with a few forma thrown into it can take on the entire universe and then some. But this has left people who grind out all this stuff without challenge. What’s the point of us having grinded out all these top tier weapons that can take a chunk out of the planet with the single squeeze of a trigger when Mr.Joeblow and his pump-action shotgun can do the same thing? Is it the gold bits on my gun? It’s gotta be the gold bits. It’s always been for the gold bits.

This is by far the best free game ive played. I generally stay away from free games because the majority arent worth the time. This game is different. The graphics are great and the skins look elegantly badass.   The intro to the game is very nice, I really like when games start of with me moving and killing things, only later to slowly introduce more indepth aspects to the game. This approach keeps me interested and prevents the overwhelming feeling of starting a game and not knowing how to do anything. This is very user friendly and balances learning and action nicely.  This game really allows the player to feel like a badass, the ingame action is really smooth and works very well. I am not sure how to say it other than it feels reallly nice. The fighting aspects of this game belong to a top end FPS. I particularly like how the sensitivity is set for aiming and turning, it really caters for snipers very well but may take an hour or so to really get used to it.  You can run on walls!  As far as the negative aspects to this game, i havent really encountered any but i can speculate. There is a market place where you can purchase ingame currency which i totally dont mind, it being a freegame and all. This is however a big threat to the game. I do believe this can be overcome but Sooo many games so far have not done so. I really hope it isnt, and I am not saying it is, But potentially Pay to Win. Great game with massive potental for the long run. Community so far has been helpful and responsive. Game play is great, controls are fluid. Learning curve for the mods and eqipment levels isnt very hard. Graphics are good. Definately a F2P game, purchased items offer a some differences but nothing that completely overdoes it. 9.5/10 one of my new favorites.   ***************************UPDATED****************************************************************   The above review i wrote way back whever that was. Wanted to update my thoughts on this game.  I can't explain in words how addictive this game is. I would never have believed that a 3rd person shooter could be so good if I had not seen it for myself. The devs have added new content for clans, and are still very responsive to the player base. Graphics are superb. Just outstanding maps for the game. Music fits the game as well. It really puts you in the setting.   The thing I cannot stress the most is that fact that this is one of the EXTREMELY few TRUE Free2Play game that carries that title. 99% of the items in the marketplace are obtainable in game. And for that matter, you can sell Prime parts/blue prints or Mods to earn Platinum(currency used in the cash shop), thus, you can buy everything this game has to offer without spending a dime.   The only negative I can even think of is the player base itself. A small percentage of the players are your average trolls. This is nothing a gamer wont be used to by now. But for the most part (again prolly 90%) the players are very helpful, and will answer questions, help a new player with leveling, ect.   Don't short yourself by passing on this game. It's a real jewel, and a great achievement for the developers. The game is addicting on every level. If you havent played it yet, youve got nothing to lose. Download it and give it a go.

You know destiny? This is the game it wanted to be...  Warframe is a hack and slash shooter with free flowing movement and shooting with some annoying f2p tricks and moba tip bits.  Pros: The guns are various, good or bad - it depends on your mods and how you play The free flowing movement system is good and can slide in and hack people up 3 factions that offer good varation but The grinner are annoying with there armor  The mods are a mixed bag as RNG decides your loot Some of the weapons and suits require you to be in a clan to get them It takes time to get good guns The suits or frames is good but be careful when you upgrade mods and there suit The crafting system is abit weird and has some pay to go tricks Overall fun --- Updates very often  Cons:  Dont finish the galaxy quickly, it gets boring The bosses are often gimmicky with weakspots The Grinner can cause a bleeding proc that wrecks some frames and exposlives The infested arent scary but the elders can wreck you  Clans are needed for some of the cool guns The market often has cool guns that you either buy with real money or take a week to grind from them and build them Most often the missions repeat. The ship and UI was better when it was menu based but that is me  I recommend this game, it pretty and unique just remember it takes awhile to get used too.

I've been playing this game since beta well over 600 hours. I also have RL friends that play which makes this game more enjoyable.    Cash shop  Warframe is a free to play game with a cash shop. the cash shop is for convenience if you don't have the time to put hours into it. You dont have to buy anything. 80% of the items can be obtained with time and effort without money. 10% are vanity items the other 10% is expansion slots so you can hold more ingame items but these are cheap. 12 platinum for 2 weapons slots and 20 platinum for 1 warframe slot.  The game  Third person 4 player co op game. main weapon, secondary weapon and a melee weapon. Run along walls up clifs or just teleport around. Nothings more fun than running around with friends and annoying them. Example my friend would run ahead to jump into a lift and start it without me but I'd use my switch ability as the lift door is closing and he'd have to wait for the lift to return while I laugh at him over the mic.  The game itself revolves around farming items like most other do. I need 2 circuits, 4 plasids, 100 alloy and 1 cell to create and new weapon (for example) so these items would be spread across 3 different type of missions to obtain them. The rarer the item the rarer the components are to get but they are not so hard you cant get them just time consuming.   Warframes  A Warframe (Class) is a suit which you can obtain in the game. Each Warframe has 4 abilities to make them stand out (other than just looks). Some are good for defence where others are damage dealers. To become good at end game finding a good mix of Warframes (Classes). There are over 21 Warframes now in game so there are plenty of options and variations to keep you interested even after 600 hours.  Modes  Defence, Survival, Exterminate, Capture and Sabotage are only some game types all are fun. There is plenty of story to keep you interested and more is added with each patch.   The Bad  If it wasn't for having RL friends it definately wouldnt be as fun to play. Also the grind can sometimes become boring. But if you do get bored there are other game modes you can play to obtain the same items when farming to keep things interesting just maybe not as efficient.  Will add more to this when I get chance lol  I do recommend this game though and if you want someone to play with add me 'Reigner' (in Warframe)

The gameplay itse;f is realy fun and epic especialy with friends, which in a lot of cases is a must. The controls are a little difficult to get use to but not absolutely terrible and you can always customize them to an extent. My major gripes with the game is that it doesn't do a good job of explaining exactly what you're suppose to do or how to advance, which get really irratating if you don't have other players that can tell you how to move foward. Also it takes you forever to get anything, you starting weapons are weak and unless your willing to pay way too much in actual money it will take you days to get the blue prints and material you need, and even then you can't craft instantly as it take you half a day to make the weapon you want. Not to mention the stupid rank up system where you have to take a stupid test where you're restricted on what you can use which you can only take once every 24 hours. This is a complete and under waste of players time especially if you're like me and it says you failed after you did exactly as you were instructed to do.  There are a glitches, I did get stuck in a mission ending one where I got teleported outside the map and fell to my death with no way to respawn inside the map meaning I wasted a respawn token. Overall I'd give warframe a 3 out of 5, the gameplay is great and if you have friends it's particularly epic, but for me this is cut drastically due to the stupid amount of restrictions and time wasting aspects of the game. It's worth a download if your interested in playing with friends otherwise just pass on this one.

Warframe is a game in which you follow a group of three really strong, cool and fast ninjas around as they do sweet flips and kill army men. All sorts of neat things fall out of the army men as they die! Your goal is collect as many items as possible before the ninjas get tired of being totally sweet and decide to leave. When they leave, any items you haven't picked up yet are lost!  The ninjas are REALLY fast and do some pretty sweet tricks, so it can be really hard to keep up with them! The challenge is part of the fun, though. Anyone who enjoys casual games, racing games or ninjas would do well to check this incredible F2P offering out.

Warframe is a fantastic game if you like Ninjas and space. You are able to sneak around albeit difficult and shoot and slash your way through Corpus (robot-looking guys) and Grineer (Ugly looking Mugs). You get a Dojo if you join a Clan (Guild in other terms) and decorate and play with your friends and allies. You also get a most of the time funny companion on your ship. Warning you may need a good PC, I can play with it on my laptop I just recieve a little bit of lag during the missions on Snowy planets. otherwise It's fantastic even for a free-to-play game.
Its a good looking game even with everything on low. Pretty well optimized. Runs at 20-30 fps on intel hd 4000 w/ i5 520m w/ Razer Game Booster (which makes a huge difference)

Also, theres the fact that once you got everything in the game or almost, well... its pretty much over even though you can still play just for the fun of it. For me, i dont enjoy shootin' and killin' everything thats in my way just for the sake of it without getting any rewards. You basiclly have to wait for the Devs to add new stuff to the game. Overall Warframe is a game i have enjoyed playing for a while with my friends and still do.

Pros:  Biggest pro:   Very well made and thought out player vs. player.  1.Free 2. Cool graphics 3. Never gets old 4. New content 5. trading system 6. Tons of weapons, warframes, etc. 7. Everything can be unlocked for free 8. Active community  Cons 1. Lots of grinding, however it is grinding only if you want it to be. Just think about playing the game and the whole concept of 'grinding' disappears.(91 hours and i already have some GOOD stuff)  2. Falls short on story/lore 3. Random Number Generation= 99%chance of getting frustrated 4. Several(All) warframes are flawed 5. Unbalanced weapons  6. Some warframes are harder to get than others 7. Stealth is a joke 8. Cover is a joke 9. Parkour is a joke( Replaced by whirlybird-ninja-spinning(coptering)) 10. Cool graphics require a very strong computer to handle(otherwise you'll be like me, on minimum settings, with a window so small i can't even read text anymore.) 11. Flawed trading system 12. New content does not fix underlying problems 13. Heavily unbalanced mods(Mods help your weapons/warframes) 14. Gameplay is not rewarding, unlocking new items is 15. Terrible tutorial(player lacks skills they need to survive(coptering)) 16. Gameplay revolves around bulldozing through fields of enemies to complete mission as quickily as possible 17. Whole ninja theme is missing 18. Gameplay: Will you be tactical and fight from cover? Will you make use of powerful abilities? Or will you strike from the shadows? Lol no gunz blazing is the only viable solution.      In conclusion Recommended because it is still fun despite the flaws.

Upsides: The gameplay is smooth as silk, guns work well, lots of missions, limitless upgrade system as well as the mod system, realtime system for constructing and return rewards.  Downsides: real-money bought currency for instant gear (worst thing to ever happen to games. have a free demo and charge base fee for the full game! None of this microtransaction garbage!), 3rd person (character blocking my view 90% of the time), WAYYYYYY too much jargon (wtf is a warframe exactly and why are the annoying AIs always calling me TENNO?!), user interfaces give way too much info at the same time (after 10 hours of gameplay, i still have no idea how the numbers or mods work... at all, I just autoconfig them and go...), realtime refresh rates (only 4 respawns and always where you fell?... I'd rather have 3 respawns per mission and checkpoints, enemies are stupid and/or overpowered (some would spot me in pure darkness when others would miss me if i walked in front of their face... bathing in a spotlight)...  I could go on but I'm just getting more and more frustrated the more I think about warframe... Just being honest.

This game is worth every second, minute, hour, day or whatever. It has every element that I like in this but, (this might not apply to some) sometimes the connection times out. Sometimes it happens more than needed but it might just be me. There is a money system and there is always those people who use real life money to influence there own gameplay, so there is the 'I'm just going to buy it instead of working for it' kind of people. Then some of the 'higher ranking' people like to come into 'lower ranking' missions and it messes up with the lower ranking person actually ranking up. But try not to let that bother you because it is most likely going to happen if you play public. Dont worry you can play public, friends only, invite only and solo. Just to let you know, there are some missions it might get too dificult for solo so try making some friends in there. This is also not a completly finished game so they are doing updates and adding very nice features. Overall this is a very nice game and I do recommend this, so give it a shot!  (In this review, if I offended anyone I do appologize in advance)

SPACE. NINJA. SPACE NINJAAAAAA.  Anyways.   I honestly recommend this game to anyone. Unless you don't have much time. Starting off is difficult, but if you have friends to play with and aid you, you'll easily get the things you need quickly, and you'll gain tonnnnnnnnns of materials over time. It has been getting updates quite frequently, so now is a good time to start.  The game has an AWESOME community, and has awesome developers, who stream frequently, show sneak peaks of futures updates, and give away FREE PLATINUM! (via Twitch's raffle feature). Platinum is the in-game 'special' currency, by the way. The items you craft do take a while, and some materials are difficult to gain *glares at Oxium* but overall, it's fun to work towards new and improved gear.   My only complaint is that it is Pay-to-Look-Good. Every color pallette is $4.99. However, there are discounted color pallette packs. The syandanas (or scarves, as some people may call them) are fairly cheap, but there are quite a few of them and each is about $2.00, and there are unique skins for weapons that are cheap.   Parkour is awesome as it is, but it could use some tweaking.  Overall, amazing game, if you have the time to play it.

Warframe AKA Ninjas In Space. This game is an excellent PvE (Player Vs Environment) game that can be played fairly well solo (One Player), but is even better when playing Co-op. With constant added new features and weapon systems, it is a fairly good game.  The various Warframes help in a variety of ways, and can play special roles as it goes up to 4 players which can make gameplay even better and possibly more fun and intense. The loot drop is very good in the way of not having people risking in losing said items, which makes the Co-op very toleerrable.  Beware of latencies though, as it may happen, ecspecially if you have bad internet/bad computer while hosting, or if you joined a public game that has said problem, which can make or break the game.  Gameplay: 8, Story: 6 (Only considering the story is fairly basic and just feels dull), Graphics: 9 (If your computer can handle it, it is quite nice to look at. The issue for me is the bloom.), Music: 7. Though it is more of an ambience thing, or it just... doesn't feel too fitting in certain situations. But it is still okay.

Warframe or 'space ninjas in space'.  My 3 month love child that i got lost with and never was found, currently at 374 hours played (yes I know, I have no life). But what is this game and why should you care! Well a shooter to be percise with a mostly pve feel and future based theme. You play in a 'warframe' a battle suit for the 'tenno' minions of the lotus space ninja organization, that give you abillities to fight your enemies and health and shield so that when they fight back you don't get straight up murdered. Your enemies are the corpus (we have lazers), grineer (clones and bullets), and infested ('Technocyte' plague) at least till you start doing void missions.   The game is mission based, so you have a solar map and each planet has many mission that you can do of verying types. I won't name them all off but the basic ones would be survival, defence and exterminate (15 or so currently). The game has 3 different weapon slots main, secondary and melee, each with differnet weapon types like shotguns, rifles, revolvers, axes, maces and so on. Then you have your sentinal slot (mini floating robot) for sentinals or the newer kubrows (dogs), and lastly equipment slots for ammo resupplies and other gear.  Now lets talk about pimping out your frame and gear with the games upgrade system of mods. You find these in mission and or trade for them with other players and they have verying rarities of common, uncommon and rare. They give things like damage and defencive boosts but also can have special effects like the thunderbolt mod which give arrows a chance to explode on contact (there are hundered of different ones).   As for gameplay, your a space ninja so you can run, jump, wall run, backflick etc.... but the levels don't realy seem to give players all the room to do these things on a regular basis. Normally people just run and gun every mission ignoring all the flips and cool move they could do because the game doesn't require you to really do any of them. The gun play is great and melee while risky sometimes is quite fun and has a hard hitting feel. The main problem that I find is when playing with other your fun is host dependent as lag can be a problem.   Now lets look at the elephant in the room. This is a FTP (free to play) meaning you have to pay for certain things like extra arsenal weapon slots and warframe housing slots and sentinal slots and kubrow slots, etc...... also the orikin reactor and catalyst which are used to help get more mods on your frame and weapons (These can be gotten in game but very rarely like I have gotten 2 reactors and 4 catalyst in 3 months). There are also color scheme and other vanity items you can buy, and 'yes' the weapons also but it's easy to get them in game so I wouldn't waste your money.   For me this is a instant recommendation anyone. It's a 9/10 for me and a 8/10 in general if I was to look with out the rose tinted glasses. 'Well Worth Your Time and maybe money too'

Warframe. Oh this game has been taking away my life for months now and I have absolutely no regrets. Perfectly combines sword and gunplay together with the mix of parkour, abilities, and the variety of Warframes.  For newer players this game will be tough at the start. I made a new account after Update 14 just to see how challenging it really was at the start now, and yes it will give you an early run for your money (I'll come back to that). Although it is hard at first, once you start getting mods and different weapons and Warframes, the game will get much easier and much more fun.   Now the weapons are a true gem in variety. You can have a primary, secondary, and melee weapon. If you really want to you can take off your primary and secondary and just go full melee if you please. Just be warned though, flying enemies will be a burdon to try and kill if you're just doing melee only unless you have certain weapons. You can do this with every loadout if you want and it lets you level that weapon faster if you bring only that choice with you in missions. You can use your standard assault pew pew rifles, shotguns, snipers, bows, laser guns, grenade launcher, rocket launcher, energy swords, katanas for that true ninja feeling, whips, greatswords, claws F@$%ING CLAWS, and a ton of other types of weapons.  Now the Warframes. Every frame has their own set of abilities for different uses. My personal favorite is Loki as being used of more as a silent helper, but if you're a new player you get to choose from Excaliber the poster boy of Warframe, Volt the Sonic The Hedgehog of Warframe, and Mag the (in my opinion) 2nd most underated frame. My personal reccomendation is to do Volt because, honestly, he's the easiest to learn how to use out of the 3.   And what I feel should be all for this little review, microtransactions. C'mon let's face it, no F2P game can live without something to spend your money on, and this game doesn't force you to spend any unless you really want to. Platinum the 2nd type of currency in the game can be traded with other players or bought with real life money. Now while I admit the set prices are a bit ridiculous, but even this is made better. The game has a set Daily Log In Reward and your chances of getting something rare like discounts of up to 75% off platinum purcheses increased by logging on for at least 7 days at 8 PM EST (which would be my timezone, yours will vary). You can buy weapons and frames if you wish, but I wouldn't as you can literally farm everything in the game except cosmetics which are the only things really worth buying with platinum aside from highly needed things like Orokin Reactors and Catalysts.  In short, this game is worth at least checking out. After all, it is free.

Pros: - The graphics and controls are spot on.  - Fluid combat that can be extremely satisfying. - Ninjas - The cash shop is actually better then in most games. Were most are pay-to-win, almost everything can be earned through grinding in the game. Also, since the game is designed around a Co-op style of play, buying Warframes and Weapons only helps out your group. - Expanding inventory of Warframes and Weapons.  Neutral: - This didn't bother me, but I understand it can bother some, so I didn't count this as a pro or a con. Since you can grind and earn almost everything, there is a pretty good wait before things you make can be used. Weapons are not to bad(12 hours), but a Warframe takes quiet a bit of time to make(3 1/2 days if you make the components at the same time, then the Warframe). With Platinum, you can complete any project instantly, so if you spend a little money in the game, and use it to craft instead, you can spend far less money then just buying the Warframes outright in some cases.  Cons: - Depending on your graphic settings, lag can get pretty intense with some of the missions, considering the number of enemies that can be in your field of view with powers being used from every direction. - Sometimes the game picks the worst person to host while in a group.  I regret taking so long to actually pick this game up and play it. It's free, so I really had no excuse besides other games had my attention. It's not for everyone, but hell, it's free. Give it a try. You may find you you spend a lot more time on it then you'd ever of expected.

A third-person co-op f2p space gun ninja themed bloom effect simulator, Whrrfrrm somehow manages to be a lot of fun to play. The only thing you can't get with a surprisingly reasonable degree of patience is item slots to store your arsenal, there's so few ways to grief people that even pubbies are tolerable to run with, and most of the enemies are obligingly punchable. It doesn't look like I've played a lot, but I've put about 10 hours into it on PS4. Honestly, that's still not a lot when it comes to this game. Oh yes, there's a lot of content for Warframe. 10 hours will get you nowhere. It's pretty much just enough to make an educated impression. So what did I get out of it?  Warframe is not for everyone. It wasn't for me, either.   That doesn't mean it's bad, far from it. The game just absolutely hates showing the player why it's good. The basic mechanics give so much agency to the players, allowing them to bounce off walls and slide through packs of enemies, slashing and shooting the entire way. But it doesn't tell you how to pull off the most advanced moves or what's actually useful. The world map lets players fight through incredibly varied missions and locales throughout the solar system. But good luck getting there with the unintuitive and vague map. The F2P mechanics, while grindy, allow free players to fully use the incredibly deep crafting and loot system from the very start. But it doesn't explain how to use the alarmingly complex crafting system. When I say alarmingly complex, I mean that blueprints must be bought or found so you can grind the crafting materials so you can pay credits to craft the weapon so you can wait 24 hours to get your new, unleveled weapon.   None of that is explained. Not even the part where some weapons and items need other weapons or items as crafting materials, which also require blueprints for crafting.  To close, the bad outweighed the good for me, but it's free. Try it for yourself. You may just enjoy the third-person-loot-based-space -ninja-simulator genre.

Probably the best game I've played in a really long time.  And it's free to play.  And it's not pay to win, though dropping 20 bucks to support the developers and take a few shortcuts was well worth the money.   This game is probably the closest thing PC will have that's similar to Monster Hunter.  The formula is basically the same. To get better stuff, you have to go do missions.  Different missions has a chance to drop certain things.  Acquire certain things, build better weapons and level up your warframes.   My favorite parts about this game is Survival and Defense missions, but more so survival.  I do wish that survival focused on staying alive as long as possible instead of maintaining your 'life support'.  I'm sure the developers made it this way so players can't just camp and use Line of Sight to take down targets.   Bad parts about this game? New players will definitely need to ask seasoned players for a lot of advice and guidance and explanation.  It's easy to 'get lost' and not know what to do next.  You're going to have to research a lot of stuff basically.   This game is also harder to solo, which is certainly a flaw for me.  I don't like having to rely on teamwork to accomplish things.  Certain warframes can easily solo while other warframes just don't have the abilities to do so.   But many players do solo successfully and they probably have a better time, so don't be scared off. Solo is definitely doable, I just wish the game catered a bit more to it.   Anyways, download the game and have a great time.

Warframe provides an easy to learn, third person shooter with some minor roleplaying abilities. The game excels at providing quick missions to pass the time, or longer missions with a squad to level and grab new gear.   The game centers around Tenno, an elite group of warriors. These warriors are masters with several types of weapons, such as assault rifles, shotguns, lasers, or poison blob launchers. However, it can also be effectively played with the melee weapons in the game; they range from large axes and hammers, to dual wielded daggers and specialty items.   Overall, the game is quite an enjoyable experience. The main drawback is the time it takes to build items. A new 'Warframe', which is similar to classes in other games, will generally take ~3.5 days to build, unless Platinum is spent on it (the purchaseable in-game currency). With patience, and plenty of weapons, there are many bad guys to exterminate while waiting.

Warframe is set in a universe where the solar system is locked in unending conflict between the Tenno, the Corpus, and the Grineer, while the Infestation threat looms over all three. You can carry out a number of different mission types to collect materials, credits, blueprints, and simply prove your skills while culling the unending threat. Warframe is a game about farming at it's core. You collect materials to make more weapons, Warframes, and companions, eventually switching to new ones while customizing abilities and stats to suit your play-style. And while the game is in essence about farming, the combat, power, and movement systems allow one to create a very entertaining spectacle of flashing steel and lead. Run on a wall, jump off, spin like a helicopter, and decapitate a Grineer soldier, then top off the display by landing into a graceful slide followed immediately by another instantaneous guillotine slash from your weapon.  Learning to carry out movement combinations and power uses all while using firearms and blades of all sort is what makes this game really enjoyable. But, you might eventually get tired of the farming and look for a different experience.

Although still in beta, Warframe is already a very strong game that scratches a lot of the itches I was hoping Brink would get to.  Levels change each time they are loaded, so replayability is huge, and the coop experience is fantastic.   Being F2P means that there is purchasable bonus content, but it's not crucial to gameplay and in fact the best and maost powerful gear in the game is ONLY available through gameplay.  Movement is much more free, forgiving and integrated with the environment than in more traditional FPS titles like TF2, which is impressive when the environment, as mentioned above, is continually changing.  Strongly recommend; low stakes and high reward.

I've been playing for over a year now and here's my honest opinion on this game.  Pros:  -Fast-paced, fun gameplay.  -Tons of playstyle options. (Many unique and interesting weapons designs and Warframes.)  -Amazing art style and graphics in general, very unique.  -Easy to learn, hard to master.  Cons:  -While there are many weapons options, many of them are not viable past the early parts of the game. Weapon balance needs some serious tweaking, but it looks like they're seeing this and starting to work on it now.  -It can be an absolute grindfest. RNGesus pretty much runs this game as all the parts for the higher end weapons and warframes are random drops that can take many tries to acquire. (Not a huge problem because even the grindiness can be a lot of fun.)  -Each Warframe that you can play as has 4 abilities that are generally fun and unique. However, almost all of them have one or two abilities that are either very weak, or too situational to see much, if any use. (As with the weapons, it looks like the devs are starting to finally see this problem and have started trying to rework some of the Warframes to make them more useful.)  - My personal biggest annoyance with this game: Many of the damage-oriented Warframes have abilities that fall off, or become less useful in high level gameplay. This is because they use base damages that do not scale up as high as enemy armor and hp values do, taking away a lot of fun gameplay for those of us who enjoy the most challenging aspects of the game.  All in all, it's a super fun game that I absolutely recommend to anyone. Most of my concerns are slowly being addressed and the game seems to be moving in a really good direction. It can be a little confusing at first, but if you do some research and talk to some people, it turns into a huge amount of fun. Give it a try, you won't regret it.

I love this game, but sometimes it is difficult to find people to play just normal missions with you unless you go actively looking for them, just straight matchmaking does not work very well. Regardless, if you work a little harder you can find people to play with. There is a mechanic called 'alerts' which are special missions that overwrite a certain mission for a certain amount of time (~1 hour, usually), and they offer special rewards. This is a GREAT mechanic. It keeps the game fresh and interesting, and makes you want to log on to check out what's happening. The gameplay involves shooting at bad guys, casting spells at bad guys, and running on the ♥♥♥♥ing walls. It's good, but it requires a lot of work.

This game really struck a chord with me. It seems to be just the right blend of MMO and co-op shooter.  Excellent developer, excellent engine with superb performance even on my old hardware (GTX 660ti).   Engaging melee combat and gunplay, combined with an INSANE amount of customization through the CCG-like Mods System really makes every battle a fun fight.  MMO elements can be too grind-heavy for some, especiialy if you're one of the 'They Will Get My Money From My Cold, Dead Hand' type of free-to-play player.  If you're willing to drop some cash though, that whole thing is not a factor.  Player Clan (Guild) Dojos can also be built, which definitely make you feel like you have staked a small claim in the game universe. Its lore, while a bit underwhelming, is excellent when it is there.  I could go on for a while with smaller details, but why still read when you can try it for free*!   *Not 'Free as in Path Of Exile™'

+Fantastic graphics, beautifully designed +Excellent gameplay (ever do a wall run into a spin attack and then slam your sword down and cut an enemy in two? it's pretty awesome) +Lots of variety in weapons, and ninjas for different gameplay styles +The game can be as challenging as you make it.  +New content is always coming out (albeit slowly sometimes) +Play to win, no pay to win system. Everything can be earned in game.  - Grindy, very, very grindy - Almost zero story (although many players have dedicated some serious time to writing out their own on the forums, definitely worth checking out) - No definitive endgame content (although this may be seen as a good thing to some players)  - Can be buggy - giga pets (ahem) i mean kubrow have the worst AI in the game - PVP is a disaster don't bother  To sum up, I still reccomend this game. As time has gone on the main fact is that the game HAS gotten better. Sometimes the changes come slow, but they come. And if you're thinking of picking up the game, there is no better time than now (especially with Archwing around the corner). And if you picked it up a while ago but stopped playing, give it a try again. The game isn't perfect, but it's still one of my main games and a crap ton of fun.

There's so much to like about Warframe, but there's also so much to dislike. The gameplay is excellent, it will keep you playing for hours and hours on end. There are enough mission types ranging from exterminate and sabotage missions, to survival and excavation missions.  The game hugely rewards you as you play more and more, unlocking its various customizable weapons and mods. This ties in a very extensive mod system. Everything can be earned in this game as long as you have patience, you do not need to pay a single penny.  Warframe also contains one of the best melee combat I've seen in a third person shooter to date. However, the game is a huge grindfest that requires you to repeat missions until you get what you want. There are tons of bugs that need to be fixed, but fortunately there are weekly updates that keep the game refreshing and stable. I have not even touched on Archwing and Kubrows yet. There's so much to do in Warframe, but be prepared as you will require patience to be the best. So, will you join us, Tenno?

Before i say anything, let me be clear, this is a very good game and i do fully reccomend it.  Now that that's out of the way, i do have problems with it. For one, the corpus are impossible to stealth through (which honestly just makes it all the more satisfying to kill them with any for of stealth, but i digress). They are a swarm of 20 or so different types of enemies ranging from typicaly gunners to chargers to assault walkers and just about anything else you can think of. This is no longer as big of a problem because the difficulty shift between corpus and grineer factions has been balanced with added grineer (unless the grineer napalm and bmbardier types dont show up in the starter worlds).  second grievence, crafting can be grindy as all hell. For as balanced as it can be (it takes lots of credits or resources that are hard to get to obtain high-rank things without paying), there is the problem that you can't upgrade your starter bow, should you choose it, until you get to saturn, which is quite a ways away from start, while you can just outright buy an upgraded rifle with enough credits.  final grievence, parkour can be at times clunky and glitchy. Example, in one grineer-style room are pillars that you are supposed to climb in order to reach the catwalk the next level. climbing these can be quite a challenge as they are not registored as flat sufaces to run on, making it harder to get up to previously mentioned catwalk.   Other than these, the game excels quite far. The combat is responsive and feels right, all the weapons feel like they're suppose to function as they do (at least the ones i've managed to use) and, in terms of looks, the game is beutiful, the orokin void especially. multiple times have i just stopped my rampage through them to admire the detail and thought put into them.  As a game, warframe functions almost perfectly into it's genre of sci-fi, but not so much into the ninja-stealth game it claims to be. however it can be a stealth game in many occasions should you get lucky to find someone who doesn't try to speed run levels or just go headlong into everything.

At first I would have recommended it for newcomers. I played the game nearly everyday until the weapon update that came out many months ago, but before that warframe twas a glorious game! Being a veteran in this face paced challenging awesome game, I was crushed to see the system make silly accommodations for newbs. Yes this sounds cruel but hear me out. Before this horrible weapon update if you wanted to shoot an enemy you could simply push the 'shoot' button if you wanted to melee the enemy with your tricked out sick status effecting weapon(s) you would simply push your 'attack' button and for greater melee damage you would just simply hold the said melee attack button doing a charged animation attack. It was simple and effective, but people complained about the weapons not having enough damage for their combo hits so they took out the charged attack altogether... Never mind the best of both worlds they threw the charge attack out and added a system where you have to toggle/shift into melee mode. This was a very unninja change to the war/chaotic flow of what made Warframe a great game. Now your shooting stance has a incredible weak excuse of what a melee attack should/used to be, your melee stance however can be equipped with a mod that causes you to do a flashy combo. So to recap.  Old Warframe shooting/melee/charged attacks at the ready at all times. Melee usually had 3 animations but that may have been just for heavy melee, light melee weapons may have had more. (I didn't use many light weapons) you could charge with both.  New Warframe Shooting mode: able to shoot and includes reduced (animation and damage) melee attacks. No charge attack  Melee Mode: no shooting available you can unleash a cool looking combo if you have the right mod on your weapon but only 1 'combo mod' can be equipped at a time. No charge attack  So in short they took out a useful charge attack, and made combat slower with these toggle modes, and added a flashy combo per weapon+mod. All because ppl were complaining about melee attacks (excluding charged) being weak. I think the ppl they aimed to accommodate simply didn't know how to mod their weapons effectively.  All who played before that update lost more than they gained.   If you are a newcomer however, you wont know the pain of going from awesome warframe to a sub par version of warframe. The only reason I don't recommend it is for fear that they may nerf the player experience again via appeasing the loud, rather than the gamer.  Think about it, they could have added the flashier combos and kept charged attacks w/o implementing an extra step for their players but instead they didn't.

If you like shooters, and you like customization, and you like to have it for free, get this game. I will admit I am a casually paying player, and will get into what you DON'T get in the CONS section. I will state right now that the only things in the cash shop you cannot get by farming are some of the cosmetic items, and INVENTORY SPACE.  Warframe is what they say it is - Space Ninja online 3rd person shooter. The game is room-based (i.e. NOT open world), and is almost exclusively PVE. There are a number of different missions you can do, such as infiltration, sabotage, assassination and more. Matchmaking is either random, or with friends. The missions are set in randomized stages, and commonly have one or more enemy type - there are three 'armies' in the game, and each has a variety of enemies.  The randomizing engine keeps you from being bored when having to run the same stage over and over again, especially when you are farming something hard to get. That is not to say there aren't any 'premade' rooms - sometimes these rooms repeat more than once in a certain stage.  Okay, that's basically what you do in the game. Now let's talk about what you have to do it with.  The player character is a 'Warframe', a biomechanical exosuit with powers. It's what you might call the 'Class' of the character. It is treated as equipment, and is freely interchangeable if you have more than one. Each 'frame has four powers that are associated with its role in the group, with the 4th typically being a huge damage AoE with a high energy cost (there are some exceptions to this).  Additional equipment includes a primary weapon, sidearm, melee weapon, and a 'pet' thing. You can also get a dog, but I don't have one so I won't talk about it.  Each piece of equipment is leveled individually, by usage (taking it to missions). As it levels, it becomes slightly more powerful, and also gains more slots for Mods. Warframe mods focus around movement, survivability, energy, and weapon use. Weapon mods can often change the way a weapon works entirely (Poison gas grenades anyone? Explosive arrows? Lightning bullets?). These mods also have levels, and are improved by sacrificing other mods.  At this time, the game has about 20 Warframes (Maybe a bit less), and over a HUNDRED substantially different weapons. I don't even want to count the mods. Did I mention customization?  This is where it gets tricky. Some of the more advanced weapons require a 'Mastery Level' - which is gained by leveling frames and weapons. To gain access to the most 'advanced' weapon (ML 8 at this time I believe), you need to master about 6 frames and 10 or 15 types of each weapon. As a free user, you get only 3 inventory slots for each type of equipment - This means you will have to have a favorite set, and other weapons you buy or craft will have to be mastered, then deleted. I positively despise games that make you pay for inventory, so if I wasn't a paying user, this might've been a deal-breaker for me.  The variety of different things you can see and experience in this game is HUGE, but unfortunately this can only do so much for immersion, especially if you are randomly matched with a high level player that simply rushes the entire stage killing everything in one hit. The endgame is also kind of mediocre-, being a constant zerg rush of enemies that slowly increase in level and amount. Still, I recommend this game. It is a positive experience as an action game, and most people can find something they like in the constantly increasing customization options.  Oh, and something I didn't mention: This game has active developers. That's right - people that listen to your woes and fix the game accordingly. They are truly awesome and skilled, as apparent in the end result.  So, to sum it up:  PROS: + High quality action with flying guts and blood + Huge amount of customization options + Responsive world with an excellent physics engine + Everything for sale can be found in-game, except inventory and appearance items. There is NO item that can be bought from the shop that strengthens a paying player over a free one. + Active developers and great support + Awesome graphical design + Great boss battles that require teamwork to succeed + Melee combat is so well thought out, it can replace ranged combat completely. Machinegun or sledgehammer, or actually why not both? + Great events with event-only loot  CONS - Endgame is kind of repetitive. But since it's an action game this might not be that bad. - Inventory can only be bought for money. Completionists will suffer. - Event-only loot cannot be found later. Ever. Completionists will suffer. - The playerbase encourages rushing of stages, which severely impacts immersion - Almost no PVP - Crappy trading system. Expect having to find most things by yourself.  At least try Warframe. Ninjas play free.
