WarFrame you are basicly a SpaceNinja that kills everything in his/her path. Iv played the game now and again since it came open first time, and it still is a very good game to come back to. I might say its one of the best Action MMOs iv ever played, since every new update adds so much more to the game. And going back to it now after a new months after it went 'Release' (1.0 when beta is over) I have to say..  THERE IS SO MUCH THINGS I still havent seen. But to be more specific about the game.  The game is like a Hybrid of Ninja Gaiden and Phantasy Star Online (with the online and having a few skills etc) Where you go around in diffirent maps (worlds) to choose what kind of Missions you want to do. There are a few diffirent missions in the game, for example, Survival, Defending, Sabotage, Raid, Capture etc.  Than beside of all the diffirent Random Level Designs and all the diffirent World Layouts (the overall Biom of the map you are in) It gives you abit more of a Replay value, since you might replay a few of the same maps to get some resources you might need for a weapon Blueprint (going to get to that soon) or maybe you want a new WarFrame Blueprint and is farming bosses.  But you wont be Farming to much nowadays since iv heard they have changed it to the better. Though it still was a blast just going in killing him over and over, and get random mods you could put in your weapons to make it stronger.  About Blueprints of Weapon and Warframes (Classes) You can buy everything with real money, but i cant say anything in this is Pay to win, since you can get EVERYTHING! Without laying a single dollar, this inturn makes you wanna play tha game more, because it doesnt feel like the game is unfair. Though it might take some time more if you do it in the Blueprint way, you can still get it without paying, so i call it worth.  First the Blueprints (Warframe or Weapons) does cost Credits, and after you bought it with credits you simply go to the Foundry (your more or less 'Blacksmithing Creation-corner of Awesome Weaponry/Gear') It sais what kind of things you need to get it. (Materials, like well things you get from enemies and around the world's)  The Mods (IMPORTANT ♥♥♥♥♥) The Mods in this game are well Mods. (not game mods that change how the game is) But Mods to weapons, that can add Fire Damage / Ice Damage. Maybe you want your melee Weapon to swing faster, well done.. Or you want to Crit more often.. Well Done. Or maybe Reload or have more ammo. Done (You do need to find them first, but that isnt to hard since the only thing you need to do is to go around killing everything and pick up small 'reactors' (Sure looks like it) And you are good to go) There are Mods for your WarFrame also, which does almost the same as weapons. You have your 'Class mod' which is 4 diffirent abilities that you can upgrad to make them stronger, then you have the normal Warframe mods, which is. More health, Shield, running speed, staminga ETC.  And here is why i say its Like Phantasy Star Online. You have these small robot Pets (that you can either buy, or create from blueprints) These buggers are extremely good, depending on your gamestyle. Some are for stealth, some for raw Encounter and some are more balanced. And yes, these buggers also have Mods, but i think you get the point of how they work at this moment.  Overall, i could just babbel about the game for ages. But why read this and hear what i can say about it, when its FREE to PLAY. Just press that Install Button and Play it yourself and see how you like it. I Though HIGHLY recommend you atleast try the game out for a few hours, till you get a hang of it. Have a good one, and happy Hunting!

Space Ninjas. If that doesn't grab your attention and make you download this free action/shooter/platformer game, then you're dead inside. Did I mention it's free? One of the few action titles out there that has held my interest consistantly for several months now, the only thing that could make it more epic would be including Space Pirates... but then Warframe would get swallowed up in the galactic black hole created by it's epicness. \  You got: Fast co-op action.  A SLEW of battle suits (i.e. 'Warframes') all with different powers and abilities. Oodles of handguns, knives, bows, rifles, shuriken, swords, polearms, shotguns, machineguns, energy weapons, biological weapons and high explosive weapons. Dozens of dynamic, on-the-fly environments. Wall running, climbing, jumping, sliding, fliping, John Woo film style leaping sideways with a pistol in each hand shooting style acrobatics. About a dozen mission types. Everything is configurable with atrifacts known as mods. Even mods can be augmented by fusing them together to make them more powerful.  Check it out, it's worth the download and playing through the intros if you enjoy action games. If you really like it, consider tossing Digital Extreme a few coins for some 'platnum' and buy some extra weapon and Warframe slots... about the only thing you can't get via just playing the game. They've earned this one for their amazing efforts.

Excellent, for an MMO. Being able to earn and change Warframes and weapons whenever you feel like it lets you try hundreds of different playstyles without having to start over. It relieves alot of the boredom from repeating mission types so often. The fact that the developers are still constantly adding new content, such as maps, events, bosses, frames, weapons and challenges makes it a great game to play for awhile and then come back to in later weeks. The game's nature of being primarily PvE may be a sticking point for some, but the game ends up being both cooperative and competative as you try to keep the mission pace with more experienced players.

Firstly, I need to state very loudly and clearly that this game is in open beta. My review is based on an unfinished product, and I will be resubmitting the review when the game reaches final release.  Warframe is a third-person sci-fi cooperative shooter. Teams of up to four players (Tenno) take control of biomechanical Warframes and fight their way through procedurally generated levels. Although the gameplay is addictive, the driving force of the game at the moment is gear grinding. Players grind for components build Warframes, resources to build weapons, and mods to attach to Warframe and weapons.  My major gripe with the game in it's present state is the lack of variety. Although the procedurally generated levels are gorgeous, the objectives are repetitive and the game world feels very generic. I'm thoroughly hooked on the game, but I would really like to see more unique environments and some more story driven content. Lazy level design and a lack of story content are fine if the game is heavily PVP focussed, but Warframe's focus is almost entirely PVE.  One advantage that being PVE focussed does have is that the F2P with microtransactions model it uses is almost immune to the 'pay to win' scenario found in so many F2P titles. The only place where you really need to spend money on this game is for inventory slots to store weapons and Warframes. This is a bit of a burn, but fortunately they're not terribly expensive. $11.50 AUD will get you enough platinum for 5 warframe slots and 10 weapon slots, which should be enough to cover a casual player's expanding arsenal. Platinum can also be used to purchase Warframes, weapons, credit and experience boosters, cosmetic items, and a number of other items. Personally, I found Warframes and weapons were horribly overpriced, especially they since can all be obtained for free in game. Buying items also (at least currently) reduces the available experience of the game, since about 90% of it is currently grinding for items.  Overall, I'd say this is an open beta with a lot of promise (and I'm certainly already hooked), but it really needs some more engaging content if it's going to make the long haul.

Very entertaining co-op, and while still in Beta, it delivers a very large amount of content. With the huge amount of customisation, both in appearances and functionality of frames and weapons, and even the ability to build something from the ground up, this game can keep you hooked for a long time. There are naturally, points in which it feels lacking for now, but Digital Extremes are obviously hard at work making this game better every moment they have. You can clearly see the amount of effort and love that are going into making this, and it seems that with every large update, the game just manages to become more aluring.  There are quite a few approaches you can take on gameplay, especially concerning the weapons you choose. These can offer incredible diversity in playstyle, which one can further change according to their tastes, when it comes to customisation. The amount of mobility is also a great factor in this game, allowing you to perform a variety of acrobatic moves to get around, or even get the upper hand on enemies, if you know what you're doing.

shut_up_and_take_my_money.png

The worst part about Warframe: Buying anything with paid credits is extremely expensive unless you roll a discount as a login reward. The second worst part: Some bugs, but it is still in beta. Third worst part: Subpar interface. Aside from that, pretty much no complaints. Best visuals and gameplay out of any F2P thing I can think of, including some pretty badass sliding, wall running, somersaulting and other acrobatics, during which you can still freely shoot and melee. Melee is elegantly handled with a single key instead of having to manually equip a weapon. Putting weapons together the long way is just the right amount of work to actually be kind of satisfying instead of the anticipated unbearable grind. The universe and art direction are excellent; the Tenno are badasses, and it's practically impossible to not be awesome. Even playing online with random guys isn't too awful; the average player barely even talks during a game, although you do run into some guys who are apparently hosting the game from a TI-83 in Kenya. All in all, I mean, it's a game about future space ninjas with guns and swords and superpowers, so I'm kind of predictably addicted. And the devteam seems like a pretty alright group of guys who enjoy adding new content.

An excellent and ever evolving world with multiple characters, weapons, and play styles to use. This game is awesome. Really, really awesome. I got trapped by a horde of enemies, aimed at a big guy about fifty feet away, switched places with him, then commenced to shoot and slice my way through the swarm. Also you can cut people in half. This game definitely has the best blend of melee and gun play I've ever seen in a shooter, and it's worth a try just for that fact alone, because the combat feels awesome. Switching seamlessly from dual fire pistols to twin glass swords to finish an enemy off with a horizontal bisection never gets old, and the parkour system is just icing on the cake. Not to mention the amazing weapon variety, ranging from freeze rays to boomerangs. Fair warning, though: it can get repetitive, so, unless you have friends to play with, it may only be fun in small doses at a time, but it is very fun.

This game absolutely amazing and extremely addicting! The graphics are awesome; the gameplay is fluid, and I, personally, experience very little lag, even though my computer is not that great and lags on most games I play or try to play.  The character customization is also very good, even if you don't have any money since some extra colors are available to you for free. And, if you do have the money, the possibilites are nearly endless from changing what type of Warframe you use to what body type it has to the decorative armor pieces that it wears, and the various color palletes give a vast aray of possible color combinations.  The only thing I'd even think to complain about is how the maps tend to repeat, but, at the same time, I like how the maps are generated randomly from a specific set of rooms each time a mission is started, preventing the entire map for a mission being the same multiple times in a row. There are a couple glitches I have come across, though, but glitches are to be expected in pretty much any game, and the ones I've seen are nothing that really ruin the game's fun and excitement. There's also that fact that there is no PvP, except in Clan Dojos, but that is so easy to overlook with how exciting everything else is.  Overall, this could perhaps be one of the best games, if not the best game, I have ever played. It is definitely worth the download, and you really have nothing to lose if you happen to not like it.

It's an MMO Third-person co-op shooter, yes a co-op shooter. The PvP conclave was added in the Update 10 in September 2013 but the heart of this game is the 4 people co-op. Each warframe have 4 different unique skills and abilities to use and quite similiar to ninjas. And when they're in space, this game is basically space ninjas shooting aliens. There are many game modes that diversify from other shooters and provide variety instead of just shooting things outright. The downside of this game and all MMOs is (of course) the 'grinding' for materials and blueprints. It's still in open-beta so expect newer content, changes, and the bugs that comes with it. All in all 8/10.

Warframe is a cooperative (four player squad) free-to-play third person online action game set in an evolving sci-fi world. Join your friends in player vs enemy raids across the solar system and master the power of the Warframes. Stand alone or fight together against enemies that threaten your world. Master all weapons, both gun and blade as you battle with your squad against Corpus, Grineer and Infested.  Always anyone to play, only things you'll need to spend real cash on are Warframe (one slot 20 Platinum) and weapon slots (two slots for 12 Platinum) , as well as cosmetics! The rest is possible to be found through free to play.  As the game is still in Beta there is constantly new content and changes being made. This is great place to create your own Tenno sanctuary with friends.

When i first stumbled over Warframe, i only read something about Ninjas and Space. It sounded cool to me so i gave it a try.   Boy was i surprised!  Before i give you a little more text i sum up the pros and cons. Starting with cons.    Cons:    - You are 'forced' to use a lot of different equipment (Warframes, Weapons, Companions) to increase your Mastery Rank.  This is actually not that bad since mastery rank isn't that important. You unlock a few things with it, mostly weapons, but if you like to try a lot of different equipment you'll get the MR anyway.   - Gameplay is a bit repetitive. Basically everything comes down to slay enemies. Lots of them. In Style. Is this really a con?  - Items in the in-game-market are pretty expensive. But there's also the trade channel, where you can get better stuff cheaper.      Pros:    - There are very few things in the game where you 'have to' spend real money for. Most notably to increase space in inventory for warframes and weapons (no space limit for ressources though). The prices for these are pretty low however and it's totaly ok. I put the 'have to' in brackets because the basic space is sufficient if you only play every now and then.   - No Pay 2 Win! If you invest money in the game you will only get things faster but they won't be better. You can get everything in the game just by playing it, besides some decorations and the afore mentioned inventory space.   - The best equipment can not be bought in the ingame-market but has to be acquired by playing higher level missions. It can, however, be bought from other players. This is also a possible way to get your hands on the real-money-currency, platinum, without spending real money. Pretty cool.   - Fantastic customization options, both visual and technicaly. You can paint your warframes, companions, and weapons and also attach decorational armor on them (which costs real money, but has no effect besides looks). You can even chose different animation sets for your character! There are hundreds of so called mods to improve the stats of your equipment to customize it so it suits your needs.   - Tons of weapons! There's everything from heavy machine guns to assault rifles, shotguns, pistols, shurikens, bows and xbows, sniper rifles, swords, hammers, axes, whips (!), flame throwers, grenade launchers... you name it! I have never seen a game with so many different weapons in it.   - Style! The animations are excellent and there's a wide variation of moves you can do, like wall-walking, somersaulting, sliding, you can equip different stance mods on melee-weapons to change the way you swing them, there are melee-combos, you can dismember enemies, pin them to walls, throw them in the air... Best thing about this is that despite the complex possibilities the controls are very accurate and easy to handle.   - A lot of good ideas have slipped into the game, for example the way clans are handled (You build a large space station with your clan, the so called dojo, whose interior is fully customizable as well, there's support for different sizes of clans and so on) or the fact that your base of operations is a speaking spaceship which is a bit mental .   - The game is free!!1   To finish my little review let me say that warframe is not only one of the best f2p-games i've ever seen but it can hold it's ground against full prize games with ease.   If you don't have it yet, get it, it's free damnit!

Awesome game once you realize it's more of a TPS dungeon crawler heavliy influenced by mass effect. You have your navigation console to pick which planet and stage, it's not like an open world. That being said, this is one of the best f2p games ever made. Everything in the game is faily easy to obtain without money(aside from a few cosmedics) and everything is based on a RGN drop rate and can be sold/traded for in game money or in game currency. It's a flawless design, you'll never feel a need to pay and you won't feel scammed if you do pay.   It has extremely fast paced, high framrate action. Definitly one of the best games I've ever played.

I've been addicted to this game last couple of days, I came back to it more than a year latter, I played in BETA but gave up shortly after since there were not that many players back then. Since this is my first review here it goes.  First things first it free to play, FREE, you don't have to pay a dollar to enjoy awesomeness of this game. Its not pay to win, more like pay to look badass.  Graphics are really well done and mission design is absolutely beautiful. (I am not a big fan of instances, but I think it works best like that for this game).  Fast combat, parkour skills, variety of melee and ranged weapons (swords, bows, kunais ect.), a lot of planets, countless missions, many warframes to chose from every having its own unique stile of play.  Game is updating every few days with bug fixes and balances,  Things I dislike: - Better and more balanced PvP and Cephalon (allow more weapons and mods). - Some bugs like falling trough elevator, getting stuck in invisible hole and damn I hate when I am climbing small box or a wall and just do backflip 20 metters behind into enemy lines. - It takes decade to craft something and when you find all parts then wait 12h to 3d (its realistic trough). - Too addictive.  I hope this helps you decide if to download and try game yourself (that you should totally do) or not. :D

All of them require timers to build them -Player market economy only uses Platinum (real money) -Most players play Void missions especially for EXP farming and Credit farming; resulting no-one playing higher level planets and only going to lower level planets to farm resources  Until the developers get their shiz together and revamped the Void and make the higher level planets more appealing to play. Having played Warframe since early beta Ive had the opportunity to see this game grow and be developed into an incredible co op experience and an amazing piece of art.  With constant updates to the game bringing new weapons, warframes and playable content, Digital Extremes (Developers) has a passion to bring us a unique and memorable gaming experience.  Warframe is a co op, third person shooter/swordplay/parkour lovefest that culminates into being one of the most baddass space ninja sims of all time.  There is a varity of weapons that can all be crafted ingame, however if you're like me then you can drop some real money to buy the premium in-game currency, Platnium. This Platnium will allow you to buy weapons and warframes directly or rush the construction of weapons/warframes/gear in your foundry.  Platnium can also be used to purchase cosmetic items, which is the main driving source of income for this free-to-play title.   Sometimes getting the right materials to build an item can take a bit of work, affectionatly (not really) called farming by the Warframe Community.  Stick with it however and Warframe can become quite an interseting and fun game

This game is quite impressive. I'm a keen RPG and Sci-Fi fan, and playing as a variety of different cyborg ninja's in space just really hits the spot.  There is a lot of grinding involved, but dont let that fool you, there is plenty of content here to keep you interested.  From needing to unlock the 20 more warframes, to the dozens of weapons, sentinels, modding, trading, syndicates and missions - you wont run out of things to do too soon.  Its f2p, and as such there is a market where you can use actual money to buy weapons and frames etc. The in game credits earned via playing missions can also be used, but only for a limited number of items by comparison. For example, you could pay 200 platinum ($20 buys 370 plat atm)) for a weapon or frame, or instead use 20-100k purchasing the blueprints for them. This cannot be done with all weapons and frames at rank 1, as some of them are xp-locked - requiring more levelling up and 'mastery' test to be passed. Some materials can also be purchased this way.  Keep in mind that any blueprints also require credits to complete, plus all the grinding to get all the materials that you need (some of which simply are not available early on via drops), so it is much quicker to pay real money, but far less satisfying (for me).  The community seems friendly enough as far as online games go, with plently of people looking to group up and do quests together (where the game really shines) or trade items and talk tactics.  Visually, its very good. Plently of eye candy and a nice smooth frame rate even on maxed settings (check my profile for sys specs). The audio is crisp and environmentally accurate.  I use kb + mouse for controls, and I found them to be very fluid, although a little tricky to master without some practice. This was only a matter of probably half an hour, so nothing excessive there. The combat is fast paced and really agile. You can wall-run, slide, spin, block, deflect shots, and generally do awesome ninja stuff all whilst waving around swords, guns or anything in between.   Lets not forget the character abilities, which are unique for each frame. There use is limited by your power reserves, which can be replenished mid battle from drops, making for some strategicly mixed combat. Powers can be damage dealing, defensive, buff, or healing, with each frame having a certain style or focus on the types of powers. For example, Volt frame uses the energy in a mostly electrical sense - dealing shock bolts of lightining or creating a defensive energy barrier, super speed or electrical overload AoE.  The atmosphere works very well, fairly dark sci-fi style (dead space-esque) with plenty of unknowns and suspicious dialogue and characters going on. There's not an exessive amount of gore, but carving enimies in halves or setting them ablaze, electrocuting, freezing, shooting or bashing the hell out of enemies is certainly violent - but is on a level that works without going overboard.   There is of course, quite a lot of customisation to boot also. You can paint your space ship, choose the colour schemes inside the ship, as well as buy decorations and attachments for your frames and weapons.  I could go on but honestly I wouldnt know where to stop. All in all this is a great game, especially for a f2p.  10/10

Warframe is one of those ones that you should try regardless of what you have heard about it, simply because of how much it engages you..... at least at first.  The first 100 hours or so of gameplay you will love the game. While the maps (tilesets) are the same ones over and over, I believe that is one of its strengths. The game is incredibly fast paced, (I find that going back to other games I'll become somewhat irritated at first at how sloooooow everything is at first,) and the fact that the game has repeated maps helps with completing objectives fast with your squad (up to four players,).  There are maaaany different weapons and warframes (the main characters) you can find blueprints for, craft, and, yes, spend countless hours farming for (And many of these weapons and frames are competely insane, like a frame that can fire disco balls of death, or a gun that fires streams of tentacles).  And herein lies one of its greatest weaknesses. Its a farming game. Once I got to around 300 hours of gameplay or so, I realized that there are many ways that you can farm and not even have to PAY ATTENTION to the game. I'm not going to list specifics, lest they get changed, but suffice it to say some warframes can be used in conjunction with a group of people and maps that allows you to essentailly pay only a few seconds attention to the game, while your frames sit around and murder countless enemies, hours on end, in the hope that you will get that rare blueprint, that one Loki Systems or Volt Chassis by the time you decide to leave the mission after an hour or so, only to come back and do it all again.  So in conclusion, TRY WARFRAME. There are countless ways to get stuff without paying money for Platnium in game, its a looot more common than you realize. The game is incredibly awesome, and the feeling of doing awesome ninja moves thorugh the air and tearing through hundreds of enemis with your insanely awesome abilites and weapons is something you will not find in other games. BUT, and this is why I don't play as regurarly as I once have, don't play it to farm. Or else you'll just be spending your time Farming to get stuff to help you get more stuff, in an endless cycle. Play it, don't farm the crap out of it.

Gridy as hell, yet somewhere between wallrunning and slicing a man in two, it doesn't bother me that much.   Probably the best free to play model I've seen. 90% of the game can be made yourself without the need for buying 'platinum', the real money currency of Warframe. Most pure platinum buys that can't be built or found are purely visual or ways to reduce the build time.   Typically if you were to build, say, a new basic gun it would require various resources and some ingame money called credits. At first the resources will be hard to get, but after a while you will be swimming in them. A basic weapon could be build for free with all the require resources in about 12 hours. I usually build it before bed so by the time I come back its ready.  Warframes, or the characters you play as, take a lot longer. You need three pieces, each one with its own resources, and they all take 12 hours to complete. Once you have the parts you build them together which takes about 36 hours. Painful I know, but its a lot better than paying 200+ platinum for it.   Most of the game is about being as stylish as hell. This isn't one of those games where you feel like a dirt farmer until you reach a high level. Nothing is better than sending a room of enemies, and adjacent rooms, flying with one Rhino stomp or slashing up enemies left and right with Valkyr.   The game is still beta so there isn't much of an epic story to go with it. No clear credits roll ending. However, the team does release a lot of updates and they are constantly tweeking the game or adding in new warframes and weapons.

A game with amazing graphics, constantly being improved with new missions and events, amazing customization in weapons and warframes, it is very difficult to play the game throughout only with the stuff they give you for free, But i haven't spent a dime on this game and i own almost everything by playing the market correctly. fairly innovative bosses though a bit lackluster at some points (one of them is literally a standard enemy with a sword who just hits really hard, no abilities or anything). The game is famous for being a repetitive grinding machine, I find this depends on what missions you choose to play, but yeah if you want to progress with your weapons and frames and get stronger you will have to do the same thing over and over alot. Probably the greatest feature of warframe though is the fact you can literally be a alien wizard ninja with a jetpack. Okay, so yes. The gameplay is a grindfest. But at least you don't have to pay for every single damn thing. What do you expect? The game's free. DE wants you to play the game. I see all these reviews saying 'Oh, the gameplay is too repetitive.' I find that statement stupid. EVERY game gets repetitive if you play it for long enough. What matters is how you play it. And when it comes to Warframe, you can play however you want thanks to the customization traits to the game, the massive amounts of characters (Warframes), Weapons, Pets/Sentinels, and Mod array. You can play HOWEVER you want and WHATEVER you want. And guess what? You can do it for FREE! Sure, waiting for things to complete building can be a little boring, and repeating missions for resources to complete said things can be a bit frustrating, but that's just part of the experience. You want good items? You have to work for them. You get there eventually.

This game is nothing short of awesome. The game has a lot of grind to it, but as fun as this game is and as much characters and items available, the grind itself is the fun. And in this game you're not the stealth ninja, oh no, you're the 'KILL EVERYTHING NINJA and looks like a badass while doing it' ninja.  Presentation: the graphics is this game are pretty with the all lighting and particle effects you'd expect. Animations are truly one of the best and everytime you parkour/melee, it looks very fluid. The art direrction is not your everyday shooter and definitly has flare.   Gameplay: this game is mostly coop PVE. Yes, you can do solo or pvp, but neither is the focus of this game. The gameplay of this games revolves on running, jumping, sliding, melee, and shooting hordes of enemies. It is a very fast paced game. Your charaters have powers which range from doing damage, invisibility, stuns, cover, teleporting, speed bonus, and just about any ability that help either you or the team. The way you progress in this game is by a 'mod' system which boosts the stats of your weapons/characters. These in turn are leveled up in order to get to max rank. There's hundreds of them and provide countless builds.  Overall: Get ready to get sucked in for countless hours of a true action game with SPACE NINJAS!

the game has nice control, its preaty easy to maneuver your way around, nice animations, you really feel like a (commercallised) ninja (i say commercallised, because real ninjas dont go around killing evrything, but in the future, who knows?) this can fit all play styles, from the stealthy, to the head-on, if you can back that up with skill of not dieing, cause the enemys at a bit of a later stage do get harder, but the first area is farely easy, cause your just starting out, and the money system is a bit time consuming, becuase it takes soooo long to get money and resources to make things, and its farely hard to get those resources, escpecially since the things need so much to craft them with, (yes there is a crafting system! but you need to buy blueprints, which you need to buy, most of them) i like the leveling system, you get your items, eg. your sword or gun, leveled up, and then they unlock more modding slots, (you get modding cards which have different effects) and put them on, but to get your account rank up as a whole, you need to get your skill level (i think) up then you take a test (kill 3 waves of enemys with a diff weapon) and you gain a rank, as you gain a rank, you unlock stuff like those space wings you saw in the first video of the store page, which you get at rank 2, which you then need to craft the parts then put them together, and again, its a lot of parts, and really hard to get ones, because enemys drop the parts in small ranges, and different/rarer items have a lower drop rate, but some items only drop at different planets, and each planet is harder, and to unlock a new planet, you need to complete the assassination mission, like taking over planet kinda, and getting the new navigation part, to get to a new planet, and unlock new stuff to get, also (as you would expect) the later planets are harder, the second isn't that bad, but after that, may need to try new missions, thanks for reading! bye! anyway, overall, this is a good game, i just think that the drop rate for money and things, should be higher, i hope the devs read that! :3

Here's the tl;dr  DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME  Here is the long version:  ->There used to be a group of players called the warbros who frequented the game during and after beta. Due to DE's lack of competence and poor design, they decided to leave the game and find something better.  ->Do you like co-op action? Do you enjoy throwing yourself out there to do missions with other bros? Do you find yourself yearning to experience what it would be like to be a space ninja with 3 other guys while tearing apart baddies? Then Warframe is NOT for you. Environments are poorly-designed with little to no creativity invested; the enemies tend to sit behind corners even when you casually walk up to them and just stand there; the controls are so poorly coded that often-times you either overshoot or undershoot a jump and end up getting stuck on some stupid crap.   ->As of January 25, 2015 DE has not only ignored a recurring issue with multiple players not being able to join sessions, but has asked the playerbase to compromise their own security or mess something up in the hopes of rectifying the issue on their own. Unfortunate for DE, not everyone is dumb enough to compromise for their sake.   ->Weapon and frame balancing. Just take a moment to think of your favorite mmo. Certain builds did certain things and made doing things like quests and whatnot either more easier or just benefitted you greatly. DE scrapped the model and ♥♥♥♥ on it before putting it in a paper bag and putting it on someone's front doorstep. They then lit it on fire, pressed the doorbell, and ran behind some bushes to watch the ensuing hilarity. I kid you not, that it the EXACT mindset of DE's staff when designing weapons and frames. They only recently made fixes to necromancer (nerfed him to the point of near-uselessness) and nova which means nothing when the primes are still varying between garbage and OP. Oh, and a majority of players prefer Loki simply for the speed and stealth aspect. Also, invest real life money in this game if you want to get on top because that's EXACTLY how you get all the best gear.   ->The archwing. Whoever was the glue-snorting ♥♥♥♥♥♥ to design this thing needs to be fired. In concept it's fine. However, the missions and aethetics are so bad you often find yourself avoiding the missions if only to NOT use the stupid thing. It's not even so much that it's difficult to control as there just isn't any joy to be had. I can't properly explain what is wrong with it because there is too much. If you have the urge to play warframe even after reading this review, give the archwing a shot and see what I'm talking about.  ->RNG. Abbreviation for Random-Number Generation. What that means is that you are NEVER guaranteed to get the same number twice. So you know how a lot of other MMO's either have poor RNG for drops while others are basically the equivalent of beating a pinata without a blindfold? Imagine if that pinata could move and think, you were blindfolded, you both were on a frozen lake, people were throwing snowballs at you all the while, and your only weapon of choice was a twig. Yes, it's that bad. 'Luck' isn't even an applicable term because the RNG is THAT bad. Oh, and also some materials for making certain weapons and crap aren't available in the cash shop so you end up spending HOURS grinding for something like argon crystals and maybe coming away with 1 at most. This isn't rewarding the player. This is forcing them to suffer for your incompetence.  To sum it up, liquidate the entire staff behind this project and either kill it (merciful option) or sell it to a competent developer. Hell, give it to EA and let them fix it. Oh, and yes, I am suggesting you give what could have been a potential gem to the Hitler of gaming. EA can't ♥♥♥♥ it up anymore than DE has. And that's a REALLY depressing thought.  3/10

This is a rather surpising addtion to my steam list. I'm used to games either being keyboard only with a passible controler support or the reverse. With this game, it feels like it was made for both from the outset. Makes me rather happy. While I have been getting used to wasd controls due to games like WoW and Guild Wars 2, I am still what is often refered to as a 'console-tard' when it comes to control type preference.  The combat system is nice. Hit detection is a bit loose, but forgiving and having some nice 'weakspot' options. Each frame has four powers you can level up with often useful secondary effects. I currently play the starting Mag frame, and not only does she have a great pull that does damange, but her second power is a shield power that not only can strip enemies down and replenish allie, it also can replenish things you are protecting and harm some enemy types (such as the pain in the butt corpus). You are give a nice load out of a Main ranged, a secondary ranged, and melee. You get to chose your starting load out in the tutorial mission.  I would advise you choice on whether you are going to solo or team up a lot more. While melee choices of the Skana (katana) or staff are really up to you, there is the choice between steath and attack. Your main and secondaries revolve around this. The Braton and the pistol are great for running and gunning with friends, while the Bow and kunai are best for solo stealth. Mix, match, and have fun.  One thing that I really love about this is that the Melee not only has a slightly different control scheme that helps with combat up close, but also can be used even if you have your ranged weapons out. Granted it's just the basic attack combos with no charge or blocks; but this does allow for stealth kills up close if you snuck up on an enemy and especially if you chose the loud Braton instead of the silent, but slower, Paris Bow.  The graphics are amazing for a game that has been free to play out of the gate. Mod options are plentiful and the ♥♥♥♥ that you can basically earn -everything- in the game... at least from a functional stand point, is rather nice.  Naturally cosmetics are the main name of the game in the cash shop. Yeah, you can outright buy frames, weapons, tools and what not, but none of that is cash shop only, only the skins are specific in some cases. I think my only quam is that a -lot- of the color optoins are locked behind the platnum wall. While they are kinda cheap, the cost ratio for cash to platnum is a bit on the rediculous side. Not as bad as I've seen in the past just... a little skewed for my tastes and can make that first purchase a bit of a difficult one (my friends could tell you how easy it is to get me to spend money in most games for even just a small costume or larger bag space, so this is saying something)  Speaking of bag space: there is none. Sorta. When it comes to having Frames and pets (i think the pets, having checked yet) you do need to buy more space for each new one you get. BUT, either you've been playing the game awhile or have actually dipped into the cash shop already. Add in the fact that you get 50 platnum out the gate, and Those frame slots go for 20 a pop. Not bad all things considered.  But as for inventory space? Infinite. And it's necessary. Crafting is actually a really big thing in this game. It's a simple, straightfoward system you perform on your ship. Often you are going to find matierals all over the missions as pick ups, and you can even get frame, weapon, tool, etc blueprints for the credits you earn. It's through these aspects that you get all the stuff I was mentioning before. Through the credit market, you find a great deal of blue prints, more found on missions and in the 'clan' dojo. Through all these methods, you can build everything in the cash shop. Granted, they are basic versions usually; but -every- frame and weapon and tool. This crafting aspect leaves only the cosmetic items as the reall pull for the shop if you are patient enough to grind out materials for your blueprints.  Is this the best game in the world? Not really; there are a hand full of glitches, the character designs are a bit odd and might take some getting used to, and the way the level systems (yes plural) work are a bit of a pain.  However, between the afforementioned crafting option, the simplicity of jumping into missions with other players and variations in mission types and goals, I can say this is a great pick up and play game.  It's free, so give it a try, you just might like it.

I enjoyed this game. It was fun and refreshing break from some of the other games i was playing at the time i found it (mobas mostly). Now when i log in to play, and it's been a while since i have, all i see is paying to unlock damn near everything in the game except for maybe weapons. I can not recommend this game until the warframes and warframe slots are taken from behind the pay wall.

The Game: Terribly addicting, but at least fun to compensate for it. The gameplay is reminiscent of a PvE version of Gunz: the Duel, or a Phantasy Star MMO with its combat systems kicked up several notches, insofar as players run instantiated dungeons with different mission objectives using an action-based combat system. Levels don't work at all as in either of the aforementioned games, though. Instead, a mastery rank represents the player's level of completion of game content, for which experience is gained by ranking the equipment you can make, as well as by completing mission objectives. For the most part, not bothering to increase your mastery rank beyond its natural progression has limited penalties. For example, a few items will be 'XP locked' and you will be unable to buy their blueprints or craft them. Other penalties include a limited trade count, which is equivalent to your mastery rank for every mastery rank that you are at or above 2. For those uninterested in ranking every piece of equipment, a majority of your time might probably be spent invested in endgame shenanigans, a la farming Prime weapon parts from tower runs and weapon damage maximization. The two go hand in hand, really. Since Prime weapon parts are tradeable and are often traded for Platinum (the game's premium currency), a savvy marketeer can sell whatever parts they have available and trade their platinum back into the market for different weapon parts or rare weapon mods. This eases the pain of having to grind areas for special mods, or waiting for them to show up in mission alerts.  The Community: Fine for the most part, but there does seem to be an elitist minority. Every so often, you'll see people in the recruiting channel ask for players which have achieved mastery rank 8 or higher to help with Tier 4 tower missions. It's rather disconcerting, since I can't believe that mastery level is in any way, shape, or form, related to skill after about 10 hours of playing the game.  Thoughts: While I previously used the phrase 'endgame shenanigans,' Warframe is not a game with a very well established endgame. The diversity of the equipment with which your character can be outfitted is what helps the player decide how far to go and when they want to call it quits, as there isn't much of a story to drive the action. Having achieved my own goals, I feel as though taking the time to build another powerful weapon or warframe would be redundant, as I've already gone through the experience of doing it once with the things I wanted to do it with and would probably get really bored. But I would still recommend it. If any combination of the words 'cyborg,' 'space,' and 'ninja' titillate you, then I'd say give it a shot.

Do not let my hours playing this game fool you , I've played it for more than a thousand hour directly w/o steam and played it since release. I've spent quiet alot of hours in the game, mostly during the first beta back when it just came out. I quitted warframe for awhile after the release of frost prime. And have recently started playing again for a month. I spent most of my time playing this game Off-book so that's partly why I have only 43.1 hours on record. I've spent about 600 hours in Warframe according to my profile. So here's a list of PROS VS CONS.   Warframe is overall a great game, the followings are the reasons why I really enjoy it:  1. Stunning graphic: Warframe has one of the most stunning graphic in the online games I've played, and the best of all is its requirements is very forgiving (which works well for my 8 years old desktop) 2. It's free - very self-explainatory 3. They give you constant opportunities to purchase platinum (premium currency of the game) at 75% off 4. Constant updates 5. Very enjoyable for people who like PvE contents 6. Very little time consuming (for people with a packed schedule; go in do a match and go to work sort of) 7. Can be enjoyable for both the hardcore audiences and the not-so-good at games audiences 8. The Dev team cares, they do alot of Forum communications, and twitch live streams to reach out to their players  However, the game still needs improvements, and these are some of the big 'CONS' that has driven me to quit it for the second time:  1. BUGS & GLITCHES - It's very hard for me to enjoy a game where there are countless bugs and glitches. I've been in the first few betas and it seems like they're not working to improve or fix these crucial glitches (ex: the launcher - bugs EVERYSINGLE time there's an update, been this way since beta) (ex#2: Ingame UI glitches - countless of instances - if you've played the game for about a week or so, you'll know what I'm saying) (ex#3: gameplay glitches - teleportation, falling into the void, freezing, 1st person, ...)  2. COMMUNITY - People hardly ever talk to each other if you run a Pug, it's like the entire community is not very vocal or trying too hard to rush games and get out as quick as possible; It really takes out all the fun there is in the game  3. LACK OF CONTENTS - One of the major reasons. Yes, they try to do events and updates every now and then, but it's not enough. Basically bringing existing gameplay and reintroducing them as an event, then adding 'PRIMED' version of existing items; those do not counted as new contents. As in after you maxed out your first frame, or set of weapons, you immediately switch to a new set and start over again, and again, and again; or go farming  4. FARMING - It's a farm-fest in warframe. I've spent more time farming than actually having fun playing this game again. Parts' droprates are ridiculous (for instance: Nova Chassis - basically it is needed for a frame and to get it, you have to play a high level survival game for rotation C rewards which is at every 20 minutes - and the droprate is just too low, It took me about a week doing that survival mission countless of time until 40 - 60 minutes every game and it was very tiring and boring to do, when most people prefer to exploit bugs to do it easier) - Wether it's gear, or credits, or blueprints you need - in the end it's all about the grind and the endless zombie-y farming.  5. CONSTANT PLATINUM SALES - Yes, I know I've listed this as one of the positives, but the ingame economy is suffering from this, since there are just way too many platinums floating around and stuff in the trading channel just get inflated  6. TRADING SYSTEM - Trading in warframe is like trading in games of the 80s - 90s, the ones I grew up with. It does not have a proper trading system, no 'OFFICIAL' standard price (just vaguely a variety for ranges - pure judgment call most of the time) - People would yell to sell their wares on the trading channel, you have to join a dojo to proceed with the transaction - Taxes ( I personally don't mind this ). Also, without an 'Official' standard price, or a median or a clear image of what the actual price for certain items, the players can literally DICTATE its value - and this opens up alot of space for SCAMMERS to roam freely.  7. WARFRAME SUPPORT - One of the worst support team, problems never get solved - as above, the launcher glitches, I've seen so many forum posts filing complaints about it, and all their solutions NEVER once worked. I had to ask people who had the same problems for help. It seems to me they really do real support stuff with platinum related issues, and transactions. Everysingle time someone try to ask for support, they will be like 'DO YOU HAVE A SCREENSHOTS, OR PROVES' - that's just bloody terrible, because I don't even know where the hell is the taking screenshot button or where the folder is located, and most people don't even bother to find out until they've been asked - some of the glitches or bugs are just their for a few seconds and they log you out or something making it even harder to actually taking a screenshots for support as proves.  8. CONNECTIVITY - Warframe lets people host their own game, which is both good & bad at the same time. - GOODS: Allowing people in their local area to have better access and connectivity to their match.  - BADS: Making it close to impossible for people with limited internet connection to be able to play to others; When you host, people can't join you or lag as hell - When you join their games, you lag as hell and get disconnected constantly or their will split your game session & put you in a seperated instance.  9. VERY REPETITIVE - Some of the maps and environments; They have so little amount of varities of rooms for each type of maps, making it repeating itself - making it very tiresome and boring to actually play, when there's very little left to explore. Also their map designs are very linear, nothing revolutionary or any wow factors. I bet most people playing this game literally memmorized how each map or room layout is.  10. FANS' DEMANDS / COMMERCIALIZED - I remember when I first started playing warframe, I remember the Developers - they were really passionate about this work, and they wanted it to be 'THEIR' game, which mean they want to be able to work and create whatever they want for the game, and I remember this because in one of their few first live streams they mentioned they don't want to take too many suggestions (and was being very dodgy about calling those suggestions 'not suitable' for the game); That had changed alot, since their steam launch - PS and Xbox version, as their player-counts grow. They start taking more suggestions and implementing them into the game - which to many people could be a good thing, because they're listening to their customers; But I personally look at it in a bad way, when they start to work on a game because of their financially driven mindset, it reduces its overrall quality of the game that they're trying to create (It's like hiring someone, pay them not too much or too little just enough to keep the issue of money off their table during work hours). I'd rather play a game where their Dev team is firm on their ground with their ideas and only take suggestions when there's a neccessity to make a compromise.  IN CONCLUSION: The game has been out for about 3 years, this game has alot of good selling points - one I found particularly attractive to me is its graphic effects and their free to play model. However, there are still alot of rooms for improvements. I know, some people told me the game is still in 'beta' phase, yes It is. However, It has been out for 3 years, and that beta phase pretty much has ended for me when they released the game on steam - So using that excuse for not improving some of the bugs since beta is unacceptable  Recommendations: Id recommend this for players who have a packed schedule, as they can burn through the game slowly. And a clear 'NO' for players who want a good long term experience.

Warframe Is a awesome game, totally free to play. You can gain every weapon and Frame in the game without spending a dime... apart from the 2 frames that have been taken out.  You must have some ability with movement controls to enjoy combat system, people that button mash, do so because they wish to, not because there is no difference.  There is a large amount of farming but not because you cant progress. you farm for XP - Mats and frame and weapon parts. you are always getting a reward, just may not be want you want.  Paying for Plat in this game will help you gain weapons and frames faster, but not by much.. the real win for paying is the get now feature and the upgrades for said items, doubleing capacity for mods (that you also get free in game over time). you still have to get the mods as random drops or again spend cash for random mod drops.   There will be questions for anyone new to playing but every gammer knows that the 'general' chat tab is full of trolls. so join a clan or ask in missions.  Your Master Rank only levels up by leveling different frames and weapons to max. but its a good idea to always have a hard hitter with you once one is maxed out.  all in game currency  Gaining new weapon is as simple as opening the market place from your ship and click the weapons tab and the weapons blueprints tab... Primary, offhand or melee. you can make a lot of different types and more as you gain master rank. joining a clan also allows for different blueprint of frame and weapons if they are researched.  Gaining new frames is as simple as killing a planet boss enough times to collect three different peices of a warframe blueprint (BP) then buying the BP on the market place under warframes then Blueprints.  building times are long and average from 12 hours to 3 days. so feel free to build as much as you can at one time. unless you plan to use plat to speed up the build.  I have never met someone that did not want better gear, never met someone that didnt search for better gear.. the basics are easy to find and get and there are a lot of basics.  New content comes out faster than any game i have played. the Dev's are cool and funny, working with the community durring game play.  I encourage anyone that loves this game to give up a few bucks and help keep it alive. and if you do, then spend it on reactors and catalist from the market place. or open up a few more frame and weapon slots.  I hope this Helps anyone that reads it and hope to see many more years of Warframe to come.

Welcome to Warframe, I'm here to give you a (relatively) detailed explanation to sate the confusion you may be having about this game!  Are they mechs? or.. like. Aliens? Or. Super-Space-Ninjas? Well, to answer your question, they're all of the above!  Technically, the warframes in and of themselves are biomechanical suits which, scientifically speaking, adapt to the nuerological commands of the user in order to operate. In layman's terms, they're literally /Warframes/.  Although, at the same time, they are run by a species of Aliens called Tenno, and, well, they tend to act like Super-Space-Ninjas. Now, onto the actual review! ______  The game consists of a lot of different aspects which are very consistent with that of MMO's, although it plays a lot more like a progressive Co-Op game.   It has a crafting system which uses certain materials that you get from completing the different planet missions, which you can then use with blueprints to craft weapons, and warframes. You can craft the blueprints for weapons using the currency that you get in the game, and you can find the blueprints for warframes in specific planet missions. (Google it)  Each weapon has a different set of affinitys, and interacts with the world differently. If you want to go in guns blazing, you can use an actual gun, or a rocket-launcher, or a flak-cannon. But if you want to be quiet, you have the option to use weapons like bows, kunai, or shurikens, among other things.  There is a money-to-online-currency system that the game does optionally let you use, which you can use to either get weapons, warframes, customizations for warframes, or color-sets. (Color sets basically let you customize your warframe with different colors).  The game plays like a TPS (Third-Person-Shooter)  If you want to get into this game expecting everything to be hand-fed to you, don't play it. Like an MMO, there's a certain grinding process to getting the items or materials you want, and a certain level of luck that's involved.  I personally find it very fun.

Warframe is one of the best games I have ever played. Yes, there is always massive grindfest involved to obtain new Warframes, weapons, and other items, and it's difficult to get customizations and skins without buying Platinum (exclusive in-game currency). Whilst I have been following DE's development of Dark Sector since 2008, I have only recently played WF. WF is a great third person shooter that combines the finesse of a ninja with the accuracy of a FPS game. The gameplay is great, and almost everything can be farmed with ease. Likewise, you have the option of purchasing Platinum with actual money, which can then be used to obtain cosmetics and gears. Having said that, this isn't your typical Pay2Win type of game; items and gears in WF are easily accessible if you are playing with a group of friends/ clan. The trade economy in WF is quite fair, and the community is awesome. Almost any random veteran gamer was kind enough to share tips and tricks, or even advise on gear progression. Most players are matured and understand that there is a lot info that hasn't been properly conveyed to a fresh WF gamer (a problem that I think is currently plaguing the MMO industry).   Here is where WF might deter new players entering the battlefield. The tutorial briefly touches on the game's basic mechanics, but fails to give an explanation about gear progression, syndicates, the importance of mastery rank, and how to open up new worlds/ areas in the game. The recruitment and trading interfaces might also be hard to maneuver if you are new to the game. WF is also not strong on storytelling. It puts the players in the shoes of a Tenno, but doesn't really explain the purpose of the Tenno properly. If you are looking for a compelling story, look elsewhere. Where WF really shines is in the gameplay mechanics. Each individual WF comes with 4 unique skills, which are unlocked with level progression. WF suits can be customised with mods, which will further enchance or reduce the WF abilities. If your looking for a good 3rd person shooter, look no further. WF is truly the MMO version of Mass Effect or Lost Planet.  TL;DR  Pros ====  - Great community - Constant developer updates/ streams (via twitch) - Great gameplay (wide variety of weapons and abilities) - Gear and mats are easy to obtain (grindfactor: 7/10) - Fun to play with friends or guildies - Cool WF armor designs and skins  Cons ====  - Lack of coherent storytelling - Some concepts in the game were not well explained

Warframe is a genre defining Third-Person Shooter unlike those of the past. I've been playing since the very first day it showed up on Steam, and it's been quite a ride. This game takes time to learn, but if you're ready, and willing, it's worth it.   Imagine if you will, a free to play game where everything in the game is physically achievable without spending a cent, the only things that are money only, are purely cosmetic, which isn't a problem, if you're willing to spend a little cash. If not, that's fine too. Like I said, it's only cosmetic items that are paid for only.  The gameplay is quite fast paced, keeping you alert and on your toes at all times, there is no down time in a mission, the only chance you'll get to take a breather is on board your ship in between missions. The combat is centered around Primary weapons, such as rifles, shotguns, launchers, etc. Secondary weapons, such as pistols, dual wielded pistols, launchers, and side arms that utilize laser technology. Melee combat in this game, is very graphic, but very fun. You will watch your enemies literally be torn apart right in front of you, from a single slice of your blade of choice, wether it be a two-handed sword, dual daggers, hammers, axes, and whips.  The Warframes themselves, are all unique, with their own powerful abilities that have the power to turn the tides of battle with a blink of an eye. There is one for every playstyle, so it allows players to completely mold the game around them to their own playstyle. Want to be a support? go with Trinity or Equinox. You want to storm in and destroy everything in sight? go with Excalibur, Valkyr, or Rhino. Or maybe you'd rather take it slow and steady? Your best bet is Banshee, or Loki. Maybe you want to stand your ground, and stay standing after everyone before you has fallen? Frost and Vauban are the frames for you.   PROS:  -Addicting, fast paced gameplay  -Friendly community, and Clans  -Over one hundred weapons to choose from, find the one that suits you best  -Somewhat challenging aspect, but anything can be overcome if you have the right builds  -Actually free to play, no hidden paywall ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t  -Consistantly updated with new content, usually consisting of new frames, weapons, and missions to keep you busy  CONS:  -If you're opposed to farming, then you may not like this game, although, running missions is always fun, so it doesn't really feel like a hassle.  -Can be difficult to those who don't know what mods are essential, or how to build a good frame, weapon, or companion.  -Graphics aren't too system straining, but if you have an older computer you may have problems  CONCLUSION:  Great game, I highly reccomend it to anyone that is a long time fan of third person shooters, one of the best free to play games out there right now, no matter what anyone says.

Alrighty! After 800 hours of logged playtime ( at the time of writing this review ) I think I have earned the right to review this game. I do not plan on overviewing the mechanics, or doing much in the way of an in depth review but hey I'll say what I think matters.  First off I will say this. As I'm sure you've already read this game IS Free To Play BUT it is NOT Pay To Win. It is however pay for convenience. Every single item in this game (except for founder exclusive items Excalibur Prime and such) are attainable through regular gameplay. If you are willing to put in the time you can get anything that you desire.  Secondly there is quite a learning curve; at least there was for me. The mod system is quite in depth and many factors go into choosing an effective loadout such as the enemy type, your weapon's base damages, and many other factors. This can be a bit overwhelming but the community is wonderful and there are plenty of guides to modding weapons and warframes in the game, and if you ask a fairly experienced player I'm sure they'd love to help ya out.  Third, this is indeed a very pretty game. This is hands down the best looking Free To Play game I have ever seen, and it's even optimised well. I was able to max out the game on my overclocked GTX 650 :)  And last if you still have any questions, or need help getting started with the game, whether it is learning the in's and out's or getting the essentials in gear, just message me and I'll see what I can do :)  TL;DR Get this game it's well balanced and fair, constantly being made even BETTER, and is truly beautiful to look at.

The game is quite repetitive. If you want these objectives, you need to grind, grind and grind. There is no way around that. In order to get somewhere you need to GRIND. Or you can fork out some money and bypass the grind, in order to get the stuff you want to go back to grinding. If you want to enjoy the game, find some friends, or find things to do within the game. Despite the tedious and redundant grinding, the game has so many things to do. There's 'Exterminate' missions where you delete a number of enemies in the map, 'Spy' missions where you should remain undetected to get the best that the mission can offer or 'Defense' missions where you stay put and protect an objective from waves of enemies. There are much more than these three that I provide that can make your game experience enjoyable. Play it for at least 50 hours of gameplay and I assure you it's a game that is fun and should make you stick if you have friends to join you :)

Yes, warfarm. One of the best Free To Play games around. The best part? It's actually freetoplay! All of the content can be earned for free, platinum, ducats, and credits - All can be earned for free with no limits.  Story -  The story is good. The game never goes much into the story and pre-content, but you can dig around for that. Story missions do exist, and the nice thing is - New stories are added in each major update.  Gameplay- HOLY HECK - The gameplay is super fun. Parkour, ninja stealth kills, and stand-off gunplay. Bosses that are each unique, and rewards for doing well in the battles. The parkour is fun in itself, and its just fun to play.   Loot- The loot in this game is.... grindy. But fun grindy. Each planet has multiple missions on it, and completing those missions gets you planet unique loot. It's quite fun to amass resources and mods to build new warframes and weapons.  Ten out of tenno.

I have been playing Warframe for over 200 hours since Beta/ release date. TL:DR Warframe is a fun and addicting game but loses its luster after a certain period of time due to lack limited gameplay. Warframe gets a 7/10.  Pros - 1) ( Spectacular ) Visually. From the robot-like ninja Tenno to the ornate Oroking Void design/ architecture to the vast biomes and empty desolate space, Warframe nails the Sci-Fi look. The environments are ( almost )completely immersive. 2) ( Unique ) Gameplay. Since you play as space ninjas, you move as such. Various parkour movement that works, flying in space with 'jackpacks', congregating with other players to defeat bosses, collecting rare loot, hanging out with your clan mates in the clan's dojo, or even surviving hordes of malformed zombie-like creatures. It's a story/ lore influenced Third Person shooter with aspects of RTS and MMORPGs. 3) Community. By far Warframe has one of the best communities, ever. I'm a person that plays games such as CS:GO, League of legends, and Dota 2. I was amazed at how nice and helpful people are in this community. 4) Customization. In a lot of games, apart from weapon customization, there are not many things to change. In Warframe, you can customize everything from Warframe and weapons, to what specific color for each individual section upon your warframe/ weapon, VARIOUS ( hundreds ) mods and mod combinations for Warframes and weapons. What is a Mod? A Mod is an item that can be applied to your Warframe or weapon that will enhance its abilities in various ways. Wanna inflict a Poison DoT to enemies hit by your bullets? We got it. Wanna give a HP Regen to your allies? We got it. Wanna make your explosive projectiles split into multiple bullets for a multiple explosions and more damage? We got it! Wanna make your arrows pierce enemies allow collateral hits or even explode, we got it. Cons - 1) It can be a bit pricey. Depending on the person you are, you will either be spending no money or a lot. One aspect it borrows from MMORPG games is the grind. Yes, believe it or not, this third person shooter will make you grind, a hell of a lot. You get a blueprint for a weapon, you grind the materials, and you craft the item which will usually take a few mins to a few days depending on item rarity. But of course, being a Free to Play game, microtransactions is DE's income. Don't wanna grind 4 hours of your life away to get materials for Prime weapon? No worries! give us 5$ and we will feed your pocrastination. Don't wanna wait 24 hours for it? Patience is a virtue? Nonsense, give us five more dollars and you can have it now! with a side of regret. Literally ( almost ) everything in this game has a time limit or has to be grinded for. One of the biggets downsides to this game. Out of the 224 hours i've played, I'd say 75% of it is grinding. 2) Replayability. I do not know if its true, but I heard rumors that Digital Extremes performs Witchcraft. 6 months is the life expectancy of Warframe players because they die for a few weeks/ months and then magically resurrected. Apart from necromancy, DE has the ability to control the minds of players and spend their money. It is truly an addicting game for a short period of time at which you realize after grinding the same mission killing the same chopped and reskined mobs on similar maps within the limited game modes that you realize you spent way too much money and you just lost a lot of your life.  Reasons to buy - Looks nice, plays nice Reasons not to buy - Boring after a while, grind, grind, limited modes/ content, grind

Really fun with a group of friends on voice coms, the co-op is great and synergistic between personal choices once you reach more advanced levels of play.  Edit 11/26/15  Not really liking the direction this game has been headed in for a year now, and the devs are stacking grind on top of grind harder than ever before. It feels very designed to push the player into buying anything newly released. We're talking garbage weapons requiring several other weapons to craft, warframe suits that take a month or more to acquire, not even counting build and research time which are (now) typically 4-7 days of waiting around. That is, unless you pay to speed it up or just outright purchase off the marketplace with real money currency.   2015 Was originally touted as the 'year of quality' where the devs planned on polishing existing content and bringing everything in line. Outside of two or three examples that were actually successful, everything they've changed has been for the worse, and 80%+ of the older weapons in the game are still complete and utter trash. The initial draw to this game for me was the unique playstyles the warframe suits bring, and the relatively diverse and unique weapons. The devs have outright killed a frame because they didn't like the way the players utilized her, and more than half remain useless or completely outclassed in every single way by other frames. This 'play the way we want you to' mentality is pretty damning and bodes ill for the future of this game.   It's also disheartening to see the devs surround themselves with 'Yes-men' in the studio and on their moderation team, with any thread on the official forums that's not positive towards the direction the game is going being locked despite polite conversation with reason given 'Trolling.' If you don't kiss ♥♥♥ your opinion isn't welcome and you're obviously trolling because how could you not love running the same missions over and over 50+ times and never seeing the part you need drop. This is not hyperbole, as datamined drop chances have confirmed suspicions that many of the more desireable items sit well under 2%.   There is no QA department; almost every single release is shipped with several bugs or breaks another part of the game completely, and any deadline is blown past shamelessly ('Just a reminder: nothing is coming this week!' - Community Manager). Every update is followed by 4-5 days of constant hotfixing as they try to bring everything they broke back to normal, be it getting stuck ingame and dying repeatedly, disconnects, inability to log in, and my favorite thats popped up this year: random bannings for no reason. Support even admits that they don't know why you were banned after you wait 2 weeks for a reply to your ticket.   It's also very clear the devs don't play their own game when they 'playtest' things seemingly for the first time on stream and load up the easiest difficulty missions available, kill some of the weakest enemies in the game, and say 'yeah this is pretty strong.' Do you walk up to level 1 bears in an MMO on your high level character and one hit them and go 'yeah, I'm strong, my class is in a good place'?  Couple all of this with the exponentially increasing grind for anything newly released (2% drop rate on new prime parts that require 5-20minutes of survival or 5-20 waves of defense to even roll for), and I have to dissuade anyone from playing this game. It's very fun with a group of friends for about 20-50 hours depending on the person, but do not think this is a labor of love. It is endless beta that has come to be more and more focused on getting its players to open their wallets. Give it a few hours and walk away. I only log on during new major updates hoping they brought back some part of the game I loved when I first started playing, but it continues to slide downhill.  Do not recommend.

Best free to play game I have played in a while. Looked at reviews before downloading - found a plethora of valid positive reviews, negative reviews were people complaining about minor issues with bugs in previous versions of the game. Very glad they didn't scare me off though. This game is a solid way to burn away a few hours while soothing your mind in a way only a dungeon crawler can.  A big concern people have is the grind, but I haven't really noticed it much after playing other MMO titles and, god forbid, Destiny. The grind is comparable to the grind you would find in Diablo 3 where you are just waiting for drops, but are not stuck behind an epic week long raid lockout.  Core game play is a rogue-like with semi-random generated maps, hordes, and objectives. As I play it I feel it is the perfect fusion of Destiny and Diablo 3, without Destiny's horrible loot system and raid lockouts.  I will mention that it is F2P, so there is a ton of content you can purchase to skip the 'grind,' but you are never forced to purchase. Nearly everything is unlockable through crafting and just playing the game with the exclusion of some cosmetic items.  TL;DR - Fun game, has micro transactions you aren't forced to take part in, and combines elements from two great genres (rogue-like and shooter) into one exciting package.

So i've spent a while trying to write a review for this game and now that the Echoes of the Sentient update has dropped it seems fitting.  Warframe is one of those games that you have to spend a long time playing to get somewhere. Whether this is constantly grinfing for blueprints or for items to sell for Platinum (One of the 2 In game currencies, this can be pirchased with real money if you wish to) it all comes down to time.   Pros: -Constantly being updated and changed. -New movement system makes the game 10x better than it was with new flips and tricks - Good graphics and visuals -Great fun to play with friends -Awesome combat flow and weapons, especially bows -Loads of missions to complete on different planets  Cons: -Can get boring as you will be repeating a whole lot of stuff -All drops are RNG based (This means Random Number Genrator, so all the drops are completely random) and you'll end up finding yourself praying to RNGeesus for the next prime part or blueprint  Overall this game is soooo much fun and is really awesome but is very time consuming and if you are impatient your money is gonna be dissapering faster then Houdini. Anyway i think this game is definitly worth downloading as it is FREE, and you may hear loads of things saying you have to pay for loads with Platinum but you don't have to buy the Platinum you can trade with others for it if you have things they want!  9/10  Feel free to leave a comment if you have any questions.
