Probably the best F2P game I've played so far.    UPDATE: While this is still the best F2P game that I've played so far, which doesn't necessarily say much, I can't recommend it to anyone. It's fun for awhile, even with all the grinding, but the endgame is just a chore without a speck of fun. The people that live in region chat but don't actually play the game keep constantly whining about stuff not being hard enough and now things are getting more and more annoying for those of us that actually play the game.  The game is also full of bugs/glitches that never seem to get fixed. They keep trying to implement new systems that only end up adding to the pile instead of actually fixing anything. Connection related issues are some of the worst. You'll get dropped mid-mission for absolutely no reason and lose everything you had.  Region chat used to be fairly helpful to new players, but it's become a toxic pit that should be avoided like the plague. There are a dozen or so people that literally sit in Region trolling all day without actually playing the game. In my Region there's a few that have been acting like gods of the game since they were Mastery Rank 6, spouting definitive remarks about popular weapons and frames that they've never even used. Even the moderators act like, and probably are, little children with too much power.  This isn't really a game related problem but people in trading can be real ♥♥♥♥♥. There's a big division between people that just stick to trade chat and people that live based on some external trading website and think that it's THE definitive trading resource. The people that stick to trade chat are usually pretty reasonable, although as with any market there are people trying to scam new players, while the others are usually just terrible to deal with. They'll instantly ignore you if you don't offer them as much as or more than their precious website says their item is worth, or they'll completely freak out on you and call you every name in the book before demanding an insane price, basically trying to bully you into paying what they want. Realistically, the stuff is only worth as much as you're willing to pay, but very few people realize that.  The rank system means nothing. The game is full of MR 21s (current max player rank), that are dumb as rocks and have no real experience with anything, but they act like they're pros that have been playing for years.   A lot of the rewarding stuff is designed to force you to play with other people which is really dumb, unless you have a handful of friends to play with. The worst part of this is that the game is jam packed with leeches and idiots. So unless you have reliable friends to play with, you have to grind your ♥♥♥ off and get really good at everything so that you can just solo almost everything and avoid the mountain of hassle associated with going public. Although, even when you complete it, your reward is completely in the hands of RNG and the RNG in this game is absolutely terrible.  Also, unless you have amazing internet, you're gonna be spending a ton of time trying to find squads for the stuff that you need other people for, like raids and keysharing. And if you do ever host something and there's like 1ms of ping difference from what the others joining are used to, they're gonna ♥♥♥♥♥ non-stop until you're done with whatever you're doing.  I used to really, really like this game, but now I can barely bring myself to login once a day. I haven't had a single day in well over a year where the game worked without issue. Save yourself a lot of time and money and go find something else.  Update 11/25/2016: After much time away from this game, I came back to find that the developers have driven this game so much further down the crapper than I could've ever imagined. They've made many systems much more convoluded and grindy than before, nerfed most of the characters completely into the ground, and made the odds of getting anything good far worse. Also, they still haven't fixed any of the real issues that have persisted for years.

One of my most extensively played games ever consistently for years... yet it still feels empty.  It seems that this game might be in Beta forever- and their Beta means changing concepts, lore, and constant tweaks or balancing. I can respect DE for their dedication to the game, and you can really see the love... yet it still feels as if it is missing something. I believe it might be the depth of the game. The concept is the same- level up your gear, kill everything in sight, and repeat. It's a very hollow, yet effective concept.  It's F2P platform is one of the best and has been debated as being a number one platform among all F2P games.   It should be noted that this game will take away one thing from you; it's either time or money, but trading in-game items proves its worth.  Key-points: *Vast array of weapons. *Varying combat styles of your choice. *The grind is extreme. *Classes are superb and unique. *Quests are decent. *Frequent content updates, hotfixes, and major updates. *A true F2P game- everything can be earned by in-game grinded resources and currency (besides the steam curator cosmetic items, this all depends on how much time you can spend playing the actual game).

There are a lot of good and bad things about this game, but one thing is for certain: YOU HAVE TO GRIND. You can spend real money, you can play it without spending a cent, but you have to grind. Now, this game is fun. The ability to climb walls, sort of fly through the air, and to be able to use whatever playstyle you have is just awesome. Now, there are some bad things too. There are a few bugs in the game, and sometimes having to wait a few hours to get into a planet isn't the funnest. Along with that, the grinding. Now if you like to grind, this is the game for you. But if you aren't the most hyped on grinding for the materials and then the currency in the game to craft a new weapon or a new warframe (or character you play as) then you probably shouldn't get this game.

I've spent quite a while playing this game and I must say that it is quite entertaining.  HOWEVER  It is definetely not a game everyone would enjoy playing. I often refer to it as 'Grindframe' as the purpose os the game is pretty much to obtain and refine all the frames, weapons etc. so if you enjoy grinding out in games, this is definetely a game you should try... Especially if you like ninja robots :P  It is also important to mention that this game has a pretty steep learning curve. It takes a while to get used to the mechanics and it definetely takes a bunch of reading to become up to date with which mods to use to upgrade your items etc.  The movement in the game is quite smooth and it is very enjoyable to practically parkour through all the different layouts, it is however not all 'maps' that are optimized for this type of movement, which is a shame as it is one of my favorite parts of the game.  Overall the game is quite fun if you have lots of time to kill, but beware of 'the grind'

This game is amazing with friends, I played for about 3 months now and still love it.  Pros: The community is nice There's a lot of things to do as a new player if you understood it (like I was) The game mechanics are simple to learn End game has a lot of meanings in this game  Cons: Some people are a plague. Scammers, trolls, and just insanely cocky people who think Mastery Rank means skill The grind is manageable after you get going for about 300 hours into the game. It's not as hard as many people think. It's hard making new friends to play with if you don't have any to begin playing the game with.  Overall, as many people say this is a pay-2-win game, it really isn't. Yes, I have spend a few hundreds on this game because I support it. (even though they don't do much about the game) but still, I love the game for what it is and what DE brings out. You yourself don't have to spend a single penny in this game if you're up for the challenge and the grind. If you love grinding then this is the game for you.   Overall Score 9/10

So your looking for something cheap and cheerful, or even better free? If your looking for a 4 player co-op experience of blasting baddies in 3rd person look no further! But you know 'Free-to-play' is a nice way of saying...  PULL OUT YOUR WALLET NOW! PUT YOUR CREDIT CARD NUMBER HERE AND KEEP YOUR HANDS WHERE I CAN SEE THEM!  Well I can honestly say Warframe is really good at making you want to spend some money. Which in my opinion is a good thing, keeps the economy moving.  You don't need that weapon now, you can wait 12 hours for it to be built.  You can get that Catalyst or Reactor by waiting out the alerts and invasions.  But you can get that faster by paying some money, even worse you can get up to 75% off ingame currency, tempting you to buy some before the offer goes away.  Look I would say Warframe is worth the download, if you have a decent download speed and expansive hard drive space, I would strongly recommend downloading.  Some points in it's favor... Everything is achievable through gameplay (GRINDING). Some of which is only avaiable through gameplay (capes...). If you want ingame currency, you can trade with the less RNG blessed players on trade chat. Gameplay is fun, better with friends though. Make new friends, the commmunity is usually quite nice. Skills, NINJAS, greatswords  Some against... GRINDING Download size is ever expanding Weapon and Warframe (suits you play in) start with limited quantity, like garage slots or such in other games you must purchase them with ingame currency.  So just download it now if you have the time, try it, and *maybe* pull your wallet out *later*.

I have more than 1100 hours in this game mostly unrecorded hours due to steam being offline most of the time (maybe 1800 hrs). See the negative issues addressed in the reviews are all 100% valid. But, they don't really become applicable until you either finish the story line (loosely speaking) or reach Mastery Rank 8. The former takes 3-4 weeks. The latter takes roughly 2-3 weeks. The roughest experiences I have had were when I started out and when I was finally crashing. The middle portion or about 80% of the time I spent on this game were well spent. Some people claim grinding is difficult and while it is there were other means that I sometimes used. I'll be honest (no hacks or cheats) i made somewhere around $600 worth of platinum without inputting any amount of my own money on this game. Just depends on how well you utilize the market chat. Also, compared to games I have played like CS:GO, League of Legends, Overwatch, etc the warframe community + devs made the game super welcoming.  Five things I loved: 1. Combat + Parkour (Best update + removing stamina) 2. Solar Rails (Disabled due to monopolization by Alliances I was part of one) 3. New content every week sometimes twice a week/Events (LOVE EVENTS) 4. Graphics for F2P game 5. Clans/Alliances (Research material and recognition)  Five things I hated: 1. Trade market (players have no idea what they are doing, scammers, toxicity) 2. Prime Frame drop locations and ABC rotation (had to play intervals of 40 minutes of T3 Survival for 1 piece which had 0.01% drop rate) 3. Viability of frames, I hate playing solely healer but trinity is loved for grinding yet no one wants to play it sadly oberon healing not very viable 4. Baro Ki Teer (items are overpriced to hell) 5. Resources drop rate (have like million of alloy plates after 10 hours of grinding but 3 neural sensors LOL)  I would recommend playing this game and enjoying the game staying away from trade market, prime frames, and the meta. Just ignore that stuff. Don't do what I did. I would grind my gear up to top tier and solo Tier 4 Survival for 60 minutes on several different frames. It burned me out and all the aspects of the game that were fun for me are somewhat gone (solar rails, recognition for being in a clan, addition of more chance in drops). If you take a break from the game its pretty hard to get back into it because of how quickly content gets added. However, if you listen to the things I say to ignore, then you will enjoy the game assuming you can get over the initial entrance hurdle for about 1-2 months.

Warframe is a nice looking adrenaline pumped co-op multiplayer shooter with science fiction environment and fighting-sliding-shooting mercenaries from the guys who co-created the Unreal series. In the last year or so it got a lot of new content which transformed the game. With these updates of course came a lot of problems.  Good: Intensive combat with unique elements. Great amount of customization options, lots of equipment, mods and accessories. Decent graphics, good performance. Nicely designed, varied game modes. Co-op play is fun. You can obtain most things through regular gameplay without paying for it. Regular updates and patches. Extensive universe with plenty to do and explore. The usual mmo grind exists in Warframe too, but it is more enjoyable. Players farm instance keys, mods, resources, blueprints for warframes and gear, and of course credits.  Bad: Lag issues with hosts with bad internet connection or location. Occasional migration and other issues are annoying. Bugs on missions, new maps containing places where it is easy to stuck. Archwing movement is pretty confusing at first, and blade feels overpowered. Sometimes hard to find people to play with due to the many sectors, making the progress harder later in the game. Combat system could be dull and repetitive after some time. New, simplified movement is pretty much broken, which can be especially annoying during retrieval missions. Geometry collusions also not help the situations. Many elements break the flow. Almost anything could be bought with platinum in the shop or in the trading chat. As far as I know there are only two ways to trade your goods with other players. One option is the good-old trade chat, other one is the bazaar where you walk around with the stuff you want to get rid off floating above your head. It is like it was made intentionally hard to get rare parts from easier sources without paying for it or grinding for days. Prime warframes contionously get 'vaulted' which means that they are getting removed from drop tables and only paying players can obtain them. Some of these primes are also objectively better which was not the case before.  Overall, Warframe is a decent game. Expansions came and it became more bugged and devs messed up a lot of things, but frequent patches maintain playability. However, there are days when a recent patch ruins the game. The amount of added content is impressive, however a few features feel reckless. If you do not want to pay the game becomes extremely grindy, and of course there are stuff which can be bought only with real money. The ultimate problem remains the fact that you cannot play alone thus it is hard to unlock whole planets if you do not have someone beside you as there is no proper scaling based on player count. This makes progress for new player basically impossible. And this review is for those who did not play the game yet, thus this is going to be a no. The game is too convoluted to be any fun for anyone who starts it anew.   MY OPINION: 7.5/10 (GOOD)  Graphics: 8/10 World Design: 7/10 Gameplay: 7/10 Sound: 8/10 Replay Value: 8/10 Free-to-Play Model: 6/10

While DE (the devs) have been adding a lot more grindy mechanics and resources that you literally cannot avoid if you want the newest released equipment I still think this game is a great game for anyone who enjoys the general gameplay of it. It can take a little while to get in to but once you've got some gear and possibly some friends to play it with, it really is a lot of fun.   The early-game when you're just learning and don't have much can seem slow and tedious at first but stick with it, I promise it's worth it in the end. If you need any help with things then most clans or alliances are full of people more than willing to help you and if they don't, the forums or reddit are full of helpful people too.   As I said though, if DE doesn't stop adding the grindy content and ignoring the players they're going to lose their player-base which while it isn't small, its not exactly huge for a strictly multiplayer game. The annoying thing is, the people I see leaving this game, leave it for the smallest reason because DE just refuse to go back and bugfix old content.  Still, personally I think for a free game it's definetly worth a play for anyone who likes jumping around slashing dudes up with a katana, scythe or just melting them with corrosive pirate cannons.

CURRENT RECOMMENDED STATUS:  Watching, light playing, absoutly no contribution to devlopment (paying money)   UPDATE 2: So another quest and warframe came out recently, not a huge fan but it went largly without issue except one of the new frames abilities. It can 'infect' other players. Now while inter player interaction is often a good thing for a co-op PvE game this crosses a line and I will explain. At the very beginning of the game you get this thing stuck to your leg and by completing the Intro/tutorial quest you can remove it. Although I am all for this level of interaction and I am sure the Devs have something in line to use these things besides a completely useless pet, it should not take a week of work to undo something some other ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ did to you. I have fluxuated with giving positive and negative review to this game and not we are back in the red. The Devs really need to get their priorities straight and push things when they are all the way complete not half ♥♥♥♥♥ with issues the they should know from experience will ♥♥♥♥ us off to great length. I should not have to play this game solo to avoid ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s of the world. One bad apple can truly ruin the basket full. The devs dont even give us a way to remove the one bad one. Untill they do I will remove myself from the rotting heap.   UPDATE 1: So I have picked back up this game after a while and am pleased to say most if not all issues I had were fixed is some patches/updates since I posted my original review. I now must say that this game is back to being a very good intersting and fun experience. However as many I simply have fallen out of playing due to finding something else after I left before. I will return when there is more unexplorerd content. Until then I wish the devs the best of luck and some bette update days in the future.  Original Review: This game is just great. Good game play, good variety, good player base, good re playability. But is has one huge fail, and I do mean HUGE fail. This past update was rushed and everyone who knows anything know it. It was poorly implemented and is the worst example of poor Quality Assurance/In House Testing I have ever seen. This is a pathetic example of people that don’t care. Either the game devs don’t give a dam about their players or the fan-boys are screaming so loud in their ear they cant hear legitimate issues. Honestly if the game rolled back to the patch pre-'Sands of Failure' this would be my most recommended game to my friends. Now I would not recommend them play if it was the last game in existence. I continue to play to try and keep up with the new events and test to see if their 'Hotfixes' (which often fix issues nobody even knew existed) solve the constant crashing issues. Here is a short list of only some of the places I crash.   Checking for updates Log-on Prompt Orbiter (Think Menu) Middle of a match Three kills from the end of an hour long mission (I didn’t get the rewards) During the end of mission screen (didn’t get rewards from this either) After the end of mission screen (again no rewards) While trying to build something in my foundry While trying to manage my mods While browsing the market While checking my codex While queuing for a mission  Get my drift? Since the last update I am crashing ALL the time. Before I NEVER had a single crash. I experienced some lag here and there and a few oopses but no CTD and the game never kicked me out in the middle of a mission. This past update was a disgrace to its developers and a disgrace to its community. Yes I am angry, yes I am ♥♥♥♥♥♥. And yes I CAN do a better job. Do it right or don’t do it at all.   To those of you who will inevitably claim I have a crap PC, I have a very very good system and a very stable setup. Outside of this game I have not had one BSOD or CTD for any other game unless I intentionally break it. there is no excuse for this, this is pure laziness or ignorance. I regret paying for the Prime Access pack I got. the devs don’t deserve the support if they push this kind of garbage to us.  The game was great before and the game is still great, if you can over look the constant crashes. I can't eat a crash every other game so for me it is time for a better game where the devs check their work.   Sub note, although I posted this review durring the time of the DDoS attacks the problems existed before they started. The attackes just made them worse and ♥♥♥♥♥♥ me off enough to actually hit submit this time. It stand by what I said, although it may not seem as bad if you dont play as much as I do.

WARNING: This review is long  This game can be summed up in three words:  - Grind - RNG - A s**tton of updates  OK, strictly speaking that's six words, but it still sums up the game. I feel that I've recently got out of it, but that's just because I've got reasonably far and kind of lost interest. I know I'm not the kind of person who's played over 3,000 hours, but I still know the game well, having been playing it for 3 years now, totalling up to 640 hours of Warframe. There is one good reason for this: It's a lot of fun. Starting from havng nothing and finding Rare Mods, getting Prime weapons etc. is absorbing and even tactical.  HOWEVER, there is a difference between absorbing and time-consuming. You wouldn't like it if you're impatient or don't like grinds (or RNG...), and getting the good stuff in Warfame is HEAVILY dependent on both of those. But if you don't mind those, then there really is A HECK OF A LOT TO DO in Warframe. The amount of content is staggering, considering it's Free-To-Play (though most cool cosmetics are only obtainable with micro-transactions). You'll feel like a (forcing myself to use the word) noob at the start - as in REALLY feel like one - when you see the Rank 30 Grand Masters with Primes and all the Cosmetics etc,, but if you put time into it it can be VERY fun.  My main problems have sprung up in the newer updates (The War Within as ironically what finally pushed me away from Warframe, when I'd hoped for it to hook me back in), and I will list them here:  - Riven Mods (My least favourite thing ever) - Rare Mods that you really want but can never find or are actually unobtainable except through trading, forcing you to buy platinum or get rid of prime parts - Virtually unobtainable Prime Weapons (Nikana Prime...) - New content rushing in far too quickly, such as an amazing new thing coming when you're still farming for the cool new content from 2 BLOODY UPDATES AGO  Riven Mods, as a separate note, I absolutely loath. I once got one, but after trying with nearly every primary weapon I own to unlock it and nothing happening, I realised, 'This is probably for a weapon I don't even use.' It is just a schlep to unlock them and you might not even like what they offer. The only other way to obtain them is through trading, and they are traded A LOT, but that forces you to buy platinum, which a lot of people don't want to do, seeing as it's expensive.  Rare Mods can be a bit 'meh' at times, but some are just un-live-without-able, such as Jagged Edge, Vital Sense, etc. But them problem is that they're called 'Rare' for a reason. I spent 2.5 years hunting for Jagged Edge and Vital Sense before I finally got them, and had to resort to platinum to buy Crushing Ruin. Hunting for good mods is the most frustrating thing in Warframe.  I could write a lot about Warframe, but that would make the review too long. The best way to understand what I mean is to try the game out.  So you may ask, why is this review positive?  Answer: Because some people are more patient than others, and some can sink a lot of time into a very time-reliant game.  If you are patient (as in very) and can sink a lot of time into a game, then Warframe is definitely the game for you.  And when you become a Rank 30 Grand Master with Primes and all the Cosmetics etc., you will REALLY feel like one.  Give it a go, and see if you like it. Just remember that progress is slow and starting is difficult, and that there is a grind unlike anything you've ever seen.
